tourName: Annapurna Region & Mustang overland tour, Nepal
generalInfo:
The Mustang Overland Trip is an exciting and fascinating 12 day journey into a less well known region, but travelling in Upper Mustang is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. It allows you to witness the way of life of true mountain people, who have had little contact with the rest of the world for hundreds of years. Upper Mustang is like being in Tibet in many ways, as it is geographically part of the Tibetan plateau. Prepare to be awestruck by breath-taking landscapes and meet the people of one of the world's most culturally preserved regions. Until 1950, the district of Mustang was a separate kingdom within the borders of Nepal. Upper Mustang was opened to non-Nepali visitors in 1994, and visiting the region today feels like stepping back in time.
SPECIAL EVENT - TIJI FESTIVAL - MAY 2025
You can also experience the Tiji Festival which is a 3-day festival celebrated in Lomanthang of Upper Mustang and which takes place in May in 2025. We combine days 2 and 3 of the itinerary below and get you to Lo Manthang on day 6, to enjoy the Festival on day 7 - May 24.
The Festival is held every year but on different dates, as it is depends on a special day in the Tibetan calendar. The Festival marks the victory of good against evil and local people from villages and all the Buddhist Lamas from the monastery gather at the place where festival is celebrated. The main Lama of the village then fights against a demon father to save Kingdom of Mustang from destruction. A special mask dance by Buddhist Lama is the main attraction during this festival and the mask dance with the special Mantra is thought to expel all demons from the area.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Kathmandu (1,400 m) Upon your arrival, you will be met by representative and transfer to your hotel. Note: Please bring your passport and a readable copy of your travel insurance policy. Overnight at Nepali Ghar Hotel Meals: Bed & Breakfast basis

Fly to Pokhara We will spend the morning processing our permits and then in the afternoon will take the 25-minute flight to Pokhara. Pokhara is located west of Kathmandu and has a tranquil beauty that has been the subject of inspiration for many travel writers. Its pristine air, spectacular backdrop of snowy peaks, blue lakes and surrounding greenery make it ‘the jewel in the Himalaya’, a place of remarkable natural disposition. With the magnificent Annapurna range forming the backdrop and the serenity of the clusterof 9 Lakes with three major ones - Phewa, Rupa and Begnas – Pokhara is a great destination for a weekend getaway as well as a long relaxing holiday. Pokhara Valley, gateway to the Annapurna region where many a trekker finds their Shangri-la! Overnight in Atithi Resort Spa Hotel. Meals: Bed & Breakfast basis

Drive to Kalopani 1750m We begin our overland journey, boarding your Jeep, drive via the Kali Gandaki Valley. Around Beni, Reaching Tatopani the road now climbs and climbs and climbs as dust gives way to cobbles. First you get views of the Niligiri Himal and as you ascend further the mesmerising peak of Dhaulagiri and the Annapurnas come into view. Things then begin to level out finally as the Kali Gandaki Valley broadens out. We will overnight in Kalopani. Annapurnas. Altitude 1750m approx., Driving time approx. 5-6hrs. Overnight in the See you lodge or similar Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Drive to Kagbeni 2810m Today we drive towards Kagbeni, and as you approach Jomsom virtually all vegetation disappears abruptly, marking the furthest extent of the Himalayan rain shadow. On your right the sharp peak of Nilgiri South is more spectacular than ever before and you have now crossed through the Himalayas. The arid landscape of the Mustang region is stretched out before you in the form of the upper reaches of the Kali Gandaki. Not only has the landscape changed, but the culture has also changed too and the villages from now on have a distinctly Tibetan flavor to them. An hour or so beyond Jomsom, we will be in Kagbeni. Typical of villages in the Mustang region in terms of architecture, along with Tibetan Buddhist monuments and symbols, Kagbeni is where Upper Mustang begins and to venture further special permits are required. Altitude 2810m, Driving time approx. 3 hrs. Overnight in the Annapurna Lodge or similar (Private bathrooms with proper beds) Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Kagbeni to Charang c. 4000m Journey starts today to Upper mustang. After the permits are checked at the police post in Kagbeni, the jeep track today pretty much skirts the side of the Kali Gandaki River Valley. Whether there is any water in the river rater depends on what time of year you're undertaking the journey. Usually from October to mid-May the broad river floor looks more like a level boulder field. Take a walk onto the riverbed and you may just hear water flowing underneath. Along the way you can take a halt and explore the small villages and see how their carefully tended terraced fields are irrigated in a landscape that is otherwise dry and barren wilderness. At Chusang there is a river tributary to cross and shortly thereafter the Kali Gandaki Riverbed itself. After crossing the Kali Gandaki the jeep track now climbs away from the valley and there are a couple of high passes (approx. 4000m) to cross before dropping down into Charang. Altitude 3560m, Driving time approx. 5-6 hrs. Overnight at Lumbini Guest house. (Private bathrooms with proper beds) Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Acclimatization Day Today is acclimatization day to get used to being at altitude. Charang itself is the second largest village (Lo Manthang the largest village) of the Upper Mustang area and is worthy of some on foot exploration. To give the legs a good stretch, you could take a hike up to the fascinating Ghar Gompa. Like many Buddhist monasteries, Ghar Gompa sits atop a hill and affords some good views of the Mustang region. Overnight at Lumbini Guest house. (Private bathrooms with proper beds) Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

To Lo Manthang c.4000m Finally, we drive to Lo Manthang today. Up and over another mountain pass of around 4000m and then a slight descent and in around 2 hours you've arrived at the Lo Manthang. It is a large village really of less than 200 homes. If progress has been good, then you should have the entire afternoon to explore Lo Manthang. Altitude 3840m, Driving time approx. 2-3 hrs. Overnight at Lotus Holiday Inn ((Private bathrooms with proper beds) Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

At Lo Manthang Today we get to explore some of the mysteries of Upper Mustang. A short trek to the area of Chhoser is the beginning of a day. We can explore some of caves, taking a packed lunch with us so we can enjoy the atmosphere of the caves, lunar-like landscape and mountains while relaxing also. Then we head back to Lo Manthang. Overnight at Lotus Holiday Inn (Private bathrooms with proper beds) Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

To Chhusang 3100m Today we drive back to Chhusang. The way back is the way in, but now the Himalayas form your far horizon, getting closer and closer as you progress. So, it's anything but repetitive in many respects. Today we recommend travelling as far as Chhusang (approx. 3100m). You should arrive here mid-afternoon and thus be able to give the legs a good stretch and take a hike to the fascinating and rather picturesque ancient village of Tetang. Driving time approx.5-6hrs. Overnight at Hotel Chhusang Grand (Private bathrooms with proper beds) Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

To Jomsom 2700m Drive to Jomsom along the side of the Kali Gandaki Valley the Himalayan peaks get closer and closer. Nilgiri South Peak becomes even more impressive and the bulk of Dhaulagiri comes into view and with luck you should be in Jomsom (2700m) for lunch! Driving time approx. 3-4hrs. Overnight at Oms Home (Private bathrooms with proper beds) Meals. Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

To Kathmandu via Pokhara (Connecting flight to Kathmandu.) This morning we travel back to Pokhara which is either: A 5hr 45min drive to Pokhara and overnight there: Overnight in Atithi Resort Spa Hotel. Meals: Bed & Breakfast basis Or if weather permits, a 25-minute flight: Overnight in Kathmandu at Nepali Ghar. Meals: Breakfast and then take a connecting flight to Kathmandu.
Departure Transfer to airport for flight to Kathmandu or home – dependent on Day 11. Meals: Breakfast

generalInfo:
Introduction:
This budget Bardia tiger safari holiday is a great way of exploring this incredible park and go in search of wildlife such as tigers, rhinos, elephants and other species. Nepal and in particular Bardia is one of the few places in the world where you can track tigers on foot and indeed Bardia is one of the most reliable places in the world for tiger sightings on foot.

Bardia is a combination of jungle, sal forest, grassland and river systems all of which are ideal habitat for tiger as well as many other mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians and fish. This makes the park one of the greatest wildlife watching locations in the world. Another great aspect of Bardia is that the number of tourists that visit the park is so low you can often have the park to yourself.

In this itinerary we have substituted the luxury lodges for budget eco lodges and so have maximised our time in the forest looking for wildlife whilst keeping the costs low.

All of our tiger safaris are guided by local naturalist guides, drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible. This not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits. We are proud of the fact that we have a 75% success of spotting tigers in Nepal, with a 90% success in spotting them on foot whilst tracking tigers in Bardia. The fitness level required for our tiger safaris, is a moderate level of walking in Nepal (as tiger tracking on foot through the forests and grasslands can last for 7-8 hours).

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned. There will be filtered or boiled water available for each guest each day. We have our own private AC vehicles with an excellent driver for all vehicular transfers. You will have a local cultural and naturalist guides. The guides have spent years in Nepal (and in particular Bardia) and know the places and wildlife and local villages. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - inquire about the availability of a zoologist if you wish to have one escort your trip).


Best time to go on a tiger safari in Nepal:

For tiger watching in Nepal we recommend mid January to mid May which is the middle and end of the hot dry season when wildlife gather at waterholes.

Why choose this tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced local naturalist or guides as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• This specific wildlife tour is one of the few in the world that explores remote and wilderness areas of Bhutan in the company of expert guides.
• We provide camera traps for you to set up and you are free to use any and all of the photographs and videos that this camera trap gets during your stay.
• All the above reasons give this, our unique Bardia Budget Tiger Safari Holiday a great success rate of seeing rare wildlife. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Nepal which explore other areas and focus on other species such as Jungle cats, Snow Leopards and Red pandas as well as many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari. We are also experts in organising treks in the Nepalese Himalayas.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).
• We also contribute to Tour Operators for Tigers (TOFT) which is an NGO in the the Indian Subcontinent which is dedicated the sustainable and eco friendly future of tiger tourism.

Locations:

This tour explores the massive, famous park of Bardia in western Nepal. The entry and exit port of this tour is the wonderful and iconic city of Kathmandu.

Fitness Level:

The fitness level required for our Bardia Tiger Safari wildlife holiday is relatively high. This is because we include jungle hikes, these are either full days (7-8 hours) or half days (3-4 hours) inside the park hiking. The terrain is rough and the heat can be very hot and fatiguing. There are also dangerous animals around (such as rhinos and elephants) and on rare occasions evasive action is needed to avoid these animals.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking. We can also include specialist equipment on request such as camera traps, infrared cameras, thermal imaging equipment and spotlights.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu - Arrival & Sightseeing On your arrival at Kathmandu airport you will be met by your local guide/driver and then transferred in our private air conditioned vehicle to your accommodation in Thamel, Kathmandu. If your flight has arrived in the morning you can have lunch in Thamel and then there is the option for some sightseeing around this historic city; we will look to visit Swayambunath, Boudnath Stupa and Durbar Square and then we will head back to Thamel for dinner. (no meals included today).

Bardia National Park - Travelling After breakfast in Thamel you will be transferred to the domestic airport to catch the internal flight west to the town of Nepalganj (~1.5 hours). One you land here you will meet a driver from the lodge and be transferred further to the borders of Bardia National Park (~2-3 hours). Once we arrive at the accommodation, you will settle in and depending on the time have lunch or just head out into the park for your first activity. There are various activities for exploring the park and today we will probably have a jungle walk or jeep safari this afternoon. This is a great introduction to this park and as the sun begins to creep behind the trees and the sky gets darker there is the chance of spotting one of Nepal's top predators as the tigers, leopards, dhole and sloth bears begin to start a night of hunting. This afternoon activity will probably be around 2-3 hours long. You will arrive back at the accommodation in time for your evening meal and we recommend a good early night as the next few days will be long and exciting as you go in search of some of the worlds most incredible, beautiful and endangered wildlife. (breakfast and dinner included today).

Kathmandu - Travelling This morning will be a little more relaxed, you do not need to wake at dawn to enter the park, and after your more leisurely breakfast you will be transferred to Nepalganj in time to catch your return flight back to Kathmandu. If you sit on the left hand side of the plane you could possibly see views of the Annapurna massif as well as much more of the Himalayas as well. Then once you arrive back in Kathmandu you will be transferred to the accommodation in Thamel and if you did not have any time for sightseeing on day 1 and would wish to go this afternoon this would be an option. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure After breakfast today you will be taken to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast only included today).

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu - On your arrival into Kathmandu airport, you will be met by your local guide/driver and transferred to your accommodation (Dwarikas Hotel). After checking in and if your flight arrived in the morning you can be taken out with a local guide to enjoy some sightseeing around this historic city; we will look to visit Swayambunath, Boudnath Stupa and Durbar Square and then we will head back to the accommodation for your first night in Kathmandu. (no meals included today).

Chitwan National Park - After breakfast in Kathmandu you will be picked up from the hotel and transferred to the domestic airport terminal to catch your flight from Kathmandu to Bharatpur. Once you arrive you will be collected and take to your accommodation on the border of Chiwan. Chitwan is 932km sq of protected forest, grassland and waterways called Chitwan National Park. On arrival at your lodge (Sapana Village Lodge) you will check in and then have an afternoon trip to the local village for a short village tour around one of the Tharu villages here. (breakfast and dinner included today)

Chitwan National Park - After breakfast at the lodge you will be transferred from Sapana Village Lodge towards your next lodge. Unlike Sapana Village Lodge which is located nearby the busy village of Suaraha the next lodge Temple Tiger Lodge, is located right on the border of the buffer zone to the park. In the afternoon you will enter the park, most likely in a jeep safari. (Breakfast and dinner included today).

Chitwan National Park / Kathmandu - This morning is your last excursion into the park. After this and your breakfast you will be taken back to the town of Bharatpur in time to catch your flight back to Kathmandu. The rest of the day (on arrival back in Dwarikas in Kathmandu) is free for you to rest and relax. (Breakfast only).
Home - Today you will be taken to the airport from your hotel in time to catch your return flight home. (Breakfast only)

placesVisited: Boudhanath, Pasupatinath Temple, Bhaktapur, White water rafting, Royal Chitwan National Park, Jungle safari, Tigers, leopards, rhinoceros and exotic birds, Pokhara, Sarangkot, Kathmandu
generalInfo:
This tour in Nepal serves up diverse culture and nature experiences in the Royal Chitwan National Park, one of Asia's most celebrated nature havens.

You'll see several of Nepal's most striking ancient settlements. Boudhanath's Buddhist shrines have led to the nickname 'Little Tibet', while Bhaktapur is renowned as a centre of wood carving. Other visits take in the beautiful 'nature city' of Pokhara, and a chance to explore Kathmandu. As you delve, discover Hindu temples, Buddhist monasteries, ancient irrigation systems, palace complexes plus dazzling local craftsmanship.

This wild and dramatic land offers pulse-quickening experiences too, beginning with an exhilarating river raft ride on the Trisuli River, shooting Grade 2-3 rapids. Wildlife encounters include a jeep safari in the Royal Chitwan National Park in search of rhinoceros, exotic deer, crocodiles, sloth-bear plus two iconic big cats – leopards and Royal Bengal Tiger. For bird-watchers, there are over 400 species – such as eagle, parrots, peacocks and kingfisher.

A trek to Sarangkot, meanwhile, delivers breathtaking views of silvery mountains including Machachapuchare (Fish-tail), Annapurna South, Himchuli and Dhaulagri Mountain, as well as outstanding views of Fewa Lake.

dayInfo.description: Prior to landing in the Tribhuvan International Airport, you could have some excellent views of snowy mountains, after customs clearance meet with our tour coordinator and transfer to hotel.

A full day sightseeing in Medieval and historical cities such as Boudhanath, the stupa is famous for Buddhist devotees and also its called little Tibet, Pasupatinanth Temple, Bhaktapur, the city of examples of wood carving and finally visit Swayambhunath.

Early morning scenic drive to Charudi (rafting put in point), commence exhilarating river rafting on Trisuli River, enjoy with exciting 2-3 grade rapids, after lunch drive to Royal Chitwan National Park. Check into resort. Tonight enjoy with Tharu stick dance/ slide show.

Full day jungle excursion such as Jeep safari to explore great one horned rhinoceros, four species deer, bison, leopards, sloth-bear, two types of crocodiles, more than 450 species of exotic birds and Royal Bengal Tiger. Canoeing tour, jungle walking. Tonight enjoy with Tharu stick dance/ slide show.

Early morning our well trained and experienced naturalist takes you into prime spot for more than 450 species of exotic birds watching tour such as kingfishers, parakeets, golden orioles, peacocks, woodpecker etc. Return to resort after breakfast drive to Pokhara, the city beauty of nature. Check into hotel.

After breakfast, commence trek through a unique terrain to Sarangkot (3-4 hours walking). It provides excellent views of silvery mountains such as Machachapuchare Mountain (Fish-tail), Annapurna South, Himchuli, and Dhaulagri Mountain. Wonderful views of Fewa Lake. After lunch drive back to Pokhara. Check into hotel.
After breakfast drive to Kathmandu. Check into hotel. Afternoon walk to Kathmandu - Durbar squares.
Departure to airport.

placesVisited: Kathmandu, Durbar Square, Swayambunath stupa, Chitwan National Park, Wildlife safaris, Elephant ride, Bandipur, Siddha Cave, Hiking, Pokhara, Devi Falls, Mountain trekking, Ghandruk, Bouhanath stupa
generalInfo:
From the charms of Kathmandu to the snowcapped Himalayas, forests thick with wildlife and hilltop villages dotted with Hindu and Buddhist temples, the scenery of Nepal is a lot more diverse than you may think. This two-week small group tour takes you through a range of breathtaking landscapes on foot, raft, jeep and even elephant back as you travel from Kathmandu to Pokhara and back again, with a few days of mountain trekking thrown in for good measure.

In the capital, a guided tour of the city’s winding back streets takes you around temples and palaces carved from wood and stone, workshops, stupas and rooftop restaurants, with landmarks including Durbar Square and the lively ‘monkey temple’. The following day you’ll drive out into rural Nepal, past forested hills, rivers and terraced farmland, headed to Chitwan National Park – home to tiger, rhino and wild elephant. This will be an undisputed highlight of your trip, as you explore the jungle by canoe, jeep and even on the back of an elephant.

After brief stops in Bandipur and Pokhara, Nepal’s ‘adventure capital’, you’ll then embark on a five-day round trip trek, taking you through forests where monkeys swing and atmospheric river valleys, with sublime views of the Himalayan foothills before you. Leaving the Annapurna region and returning to Kathmandu, you have the option of taking a memorable flight to see Everest.

As the trip winds down, there is time left for some last-minute sightseeing around key historic and religious landmarks, and seeking out some unique souvenirs in the capital’s many little stalls, markets and workshops. You can't take a monkey home with you though, sorry.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Kathmandu, transfer to hotel We greet you on your arrival in Kathmandu airport today and transfer you to your hotel in the Thamel tourist disctrict of the city. Our rep will help you settle in and familiarise you with the local area. OVERNIGHT

Thamel Rickshaw Ride. Walk around Durbar Square, visit Swayambunath Stupa Our Nepal tour starts with an exciting Rickshaw ride through the backstreets of Thamel, to Durbar Square. We'll pass through small back streets full of numerous tiny shops, workshops, temples, and stupas to Durbar Square with its array of wooden and stone carved temples and palaces, where we'll have plenty of time to walk around and explore. After lunch at a rooftop restaurant overlooking the square, we drive to the important Swayambunath Stupa which sits on a hilltop overlooking the city, visible from miles around. Also known locally as the 'monkey temple', we'll see these nimble inhabitants scampering in and around the trees and temple. OVERNIGHT

Drive to Chitwan National Park, rafting option This morning we drive out of the Kathmandu Valley and drive to Chitwan National Park in the lowland Terai region of Nepal that borders India (approx. 7-8 hours). This will be our first taste of rural Nepal, and we'll see terraced farmland, forested hills, and rushing rivers. An option is available today to spend a few hours white water rafting on the Trisuli river (requires advance booking). Those choosing this option will rejoin the group in Chitwan this evening). On arrival in Chitwan, we check into our lodge, and then take an early evening village walk to see how the local Tharu people live and work. OVERNIGHT

Chitwan National Park wildlife safaris. Evening Tharu Dance performance We spend the whole day today exploring Chitwan National Park in search of the endangered Asian one-horned rhino, which Chitwan is famous for protecting. If you're very lucky you may also see a leopard, wild elephant or sloth bear, or even an elusive Bengal tiger, while the rhino, deer, monkeys, sloth bears, wild boar and numerous different birdlife are common sightings. Activities included are a jungle walk, river canoe trip and jeep safari. This evening you'll experience the vibrant culture of the Tharu people with an unforgettable dance performance. As the sun sets over the jungle, be mesmerized by the rhythmic beats and graceful movements of traditional Tharu dancers, adorned in colorful attire. This captivating performance offers a unique glimpse into the rich heritage and artistic traditions of the Tharu community, creating a truly immersive cultural experience. OVERNIGHT

Chitwan to the hilltop village of Bandipur. Bandipur walking tour Early this morning you can take a walk outside the park dedicated mainly to bird watching. After breakfast we then leave Chitwan and the Terai and drive to the ancient hilltop Newari trading village of Bandipur. The centre of Bandipur has been restored, and is vehicle free, with some lovely old buildings. We'll have a short guided walking tour around the centre of Bandipur before you have free time this afternoon to relax, or take a walk or hike through the surrounding fields, villages and hills. Walks include a 2-hour downhill hike through fields and forest to Siddha Cave, one of the largest in Asia and full of impressive rock formations (bring a torch). You can hike back uphill to Bandipur from here or walk down to the highway for our vehicle to pick you up. A shorter walk from the town centre can take you uphill for around 30min to the Thani Mai Temple, which is well worth it for its views at sunset if the weather is clear. In fact the whole of Bandipur affords good mountain views. OVERNIGHT

Morning drive to Pokhara. Pokhara Tour, Boat ride of Lake Phewa and Momo making class We leave Bandipur early this morning and drive on to the lakeside town of Pokhara, which sits at the base of the Annapurna range of mountains and is the main access point for trekking and rafting in the area. We have an action packed afternoon ahead which will include visits to Devi Falls, the Tibetan Refugee Camp and the hilltop Peace Pagoda, which offers amazing views over Pokhara. After visiting the Peace Pagoda, we'll begin a short hike downhill to the shores of Lake Phewa, from where we'll take a boat accross the lake, back to the centre of Pokhara. On our final stop of the day, we'll learn how to make momos, the traditional steamed dumplings, popular throughout Nepal and Tibet. OVERNIGHT

Drive to Naya Pul, trek to Ghandruk We drive through low hills and valleys via the village of Lumle to Nayapul. We start our trek through the Annapurna foothills here by walking to Birethanti (approx. 1-2 hours) before continuing on a path following the Modi Khola river which is fairly flat until you begin your long ascent from Shauli Bazaar to Ghandruk. The town of Ghandruk is an important settlement in the region and is the heart of the Annapurna Conservation Area Project, as well as home to thousands of serving and retired Gurkha soldiers. The total trekking for today is approximately 5-6 hours. OVERNIGHT

Trekking from Ghandruk to Tadapani The walk from Ghandruk to Tadapani passes through several types of forest, some with unusual trails of moss hanging down from the tree branches. The rhododendron forest here is considered one of the largest in the world, and is a spectacular sight in spring when the trees come into flower. Once you arrive in Tadapani you will be rewarded with spectacular views of Annapurna South, Hiunchuli and Machhapuchhare. The total trekking for today is approximately 4 hours, so you have plenty of time for photo stops and perhaps to visit the Old Gurung museum before you leave Ghandruk which displays traditional clothes and equipment used by the local Gurung people. OVERNIGHT

Trekking from Tadapani to Ghorepani The trail between Tadapani and Ghorepani crosses several river valleys and winds its way through more rhododendron forests where monkeys are often seen. After leaving the mountain forests behind you can get some clearer views before arriving in Bantanthi. You have time to rest for a while in Bantanthi before climbing through forests and following a grass and pine covered ridge to Ghorepani. The total trekking for today is approximately 4-5 hours. OVERNIGHT

Sunrise on Poon Hill, trekking from Ghorepani to Tirkhedunga We start early today and climb up to Poon Hill for great views of the Annapurna Range and Macchapuchare in particular. The rising mists over the foothills of the Himalayas stretching into the distance away from you are also a beautiful sight. After returning to the lodge for breakfast, we walk down to Tirkhedunga through oak and rhododendron forests via Nangethanti, Banthanti and a steep stepped descent from Ulleri. Today's trekking time is approximately 5-6 hours. OVERNIGHT

Finish trek, free time in Pokhara We finish trekking today by walking from Tirkhedunga back to Naya Pul with some more steep descents and beautiful scenery. After driving back into Pokhara the rest of the day is free to relax, take a boat out on the lake, or enjoy a relaxing meal and drink at one of the Lakeside area's many restaurants while reflecting on your trek. Today's trekking time is approximately 3 hours. OVERNIGHT

Transfer from Pokhara to Kathmandu We leave the Annapurna region behind this morning and take a tourist bus back to Kathmandu (approx. 7-8 hours). An upgrade to a domestic flight is available on request. The remainder of the day and evening is free to settle back into busy city life again! OVERNIGHT

Bhaktapur ancient centre with pottery lesson. Head to Nagarkot This morning you have the option of taking a spectacular mountain viewing flight to see Everest and its surrounding peaks up close. Otherwise, the morning is free to check out the shops and markets in Kathmandu for some souvenirs. This afternoon we embark on a guided tour of Bhaktapur's ancient center. The centre of Bhaktapur has been designated a World Heritage Site, and hosts the best preserved ancient buildings and temples in the Kathmandu valley, with some great examples of traditional wooden architecture to be seen. Our tour here will really give you a taste for how life has been led in the valley for centuries, and you'll see several traditional crafts still taking place, including a whole square dedicated to pottery where you'll have the opportunity to join an included pottery class. Later, we head into the hills surrounding the valley and spend the night in the village of Nagarkot. The village is perched on a ridge and is known for having some of the best views in the Kathmandu Valley. OVERNIGHT

Walk to Changu Narayan temple, Pasupatinath and Boudhanath This morning we hope for spectacular sunrise views from Nagarkot before walking downhill through the Tilkot Forest Reserve and along a ridge with classic terraced farmland on either side to the regions oldest Temple - Changu Narayan. We drive back from here to Kathmandu, stopping en-route at two of the cities most important, and contrasting religious pilgrimage sites - Pasupatinath temple (Hindu) and Boudhanath stupa (Buddhist). The evening is free for you to explore Kathmandu and Thamel one last time and enjoy a farewell meal together. OVERNIGHT

Kathmandu, free time, transfer to airport You have some free time in Kathmandu today until we transfer you to the airport for departure. Extensions to the tour are available to add more trekking, white water rafting or to visit Bardia National Park (the best place in Nepal to see tigers). First thing this morning there is also another option to take a spectacular mountain viewing flight up to see Mt. Everest (requires an evening international flight departure). OVERNIGHT

tourName: Clouded leopard group expedition in Nepal
generalInfo:
Introduction:
For a very long time clouded leopards were among the top of every wildlife enthusiasts wish lists (which has not changed), but for a long time the chances of seeing one were lottery like odds. Very few people were ever lucky enough to happen chance across one as they trekked in various forests around South and South East Asia. All of that changed around 5 years ago when a wonderful forestry department opened its up for tourism in Sabah, Malaysia (Deramakot Forest Reserve) and the rate of seeing this wonderful species shot up drastically. But nearly at the same time as this location arrived on the wildlife watching scene the clouded leopard was split into two different species; the Indochinese clouded leopard (native to the mainland of Asia) and the Sunda clouded leopard (found on Sumatra and Borneo). So whilst seeing the Sunda clouded leopard is now possible (although still with some luck and the right guides), there remained nowhere to see the Indochinese clouded leopard – well that was until very recently.
Due to some very adventurous solo travellers and the incredible work of clouded leopard researchers various parks and forests in the north-east of India and along the Himalayan foothills of Nepal have been extensively studied and tracked with views of finding clouded leopard populations and possibly getting a sighting. The breakthrough came in late 2018 and since then we have been working hard with the best clouded leopard researchers in Nepal to pioneer the first ever group tour to try and find this species. We have also hired the serviced of Mike Gordon, the dedicated and passionate wildlife spotter and guide from Sabah, made famous for his numerous sightings of Sunda clouded leopards. Possibly no one in the world understands this species better than Mike and we are delighted that he will be guiding our new Clouded Leopard Expeditions to Nepal.
But there are other advantages of travelling to this region of Nepal to look for this species of clouded leopard, not just that it is a different species from the Bornean ones, but also that Nepal offers a brand new wildlife experience and also the price is cheaper and a whole new set of species can be seen in these forests too.
So why not branch out and away from Sabah, Borneo and cast the clouded leopard net wider. This tour is unique and offers the chance to explore a wonderful forest which is seldom visited and little understood. But in recent times this area has become a hotbed for clouded leopard sightings.
We do our best to pioneer as many new trips as possible, to try and get people out to the newest and best wildlife watching destinations ahead of the larger companies and the bigger groups. This is the latest in a long list of pioneering mammal watching tours from us and it will not be the last.
So we hope you decide to book on this unique big cat watching tour, dedicated to the Indochinese clouded leopard, however if you wish to know more about the Sunda clouded leopard we also offer a rare mammals tour of Borneo where the Sunda clouded leopard is a top targeted species. Just contact us for more information or our brochure.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned. There will be filtered or boiled water available for each guest each day. We have our own private AC vehicles with an excellent driver for all vehicular transfers. You will have a local cultural and naturalist guides including a Nepalese clouded leopard specialist. We also have a the expert help of the world's most renowned clouded leopard guide from Borneo. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us). We also have high powered spotlights, quality optical equipment, night-vision and thermal imaging equipment (on request).


Best time for this Nepal expedition for clouded leopards:

This tour can be booked anytime of the year, however we recommend avoiding the height of winter. And we think that spring and autumn are the best seasons to visit. This would be from late February – May and then September – mid November.

Why choose this tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced local naturalist or guides as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We employ three different specialist clouded leopard guides, firstly a local guide who knows the particular region intimately, secondly a Nepalese biologist who specialises in clouded leopards and then a guide who has probably see more clouded leopards than any living person.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• This specific wildlife tour is one of the few in the world that explores remote and wilderness areas of Nepal in the company of expert guides.
• We provide camera traps for you to set up and you are free to use any and all of the photographs and videos that this camera trap gets during your stay.
• All the above reasons give this, our unique Clouded Leopard Expedition of Nepal a great success rate of seeing rare wildlife. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Nepal which explore other areas and focus on other species such as Tigers, One-horned Rhinos, Jungle cats and Red pandas as well as many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari. We are also experts in organising treks in the Nepalese Himalayas.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour explores the massive and famous national park of Langtang in central Nepal. The entry and exit point of this tour is the wonderful and iconic city of Kathmandu.

Fitness Level:

The fitness level required for our Nepal Clouded Leopard Expedition is relatively high. This is because the tour is at altitude and the hiking to and from the guesthouse and the hiking to get to observation points can be steep and on uneven ground. Anyone who is used to hiking for 2-3 hours at a time (preferably at altitude) will not have a problem, anyone who has experienced altitude whilst hiking will most likely also be ok.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking. We can also include specialist equipment on request such as camera traps, infrared cameras, thermal imaging equipment and spotlights.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu On arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport you will be met by your tour guide and our local guide/driver. From the airport we will be transferred in our private vehicle into the middle of Kathmandu (20-30 mins). Once here we will head to the Thamel district and your hotel for the night. If there is time you will be taken around the winding streets of Thamel. This area is the heartbeat of Kathmandu and a place which teems with colour, sights and sounds. You can easily get lost meandering down the maze of streets souvenir shopping and we can spend hours here enjoying the hustle and bustle of Nepal’s busiest city. Whilst still very touristy Thamel is a good welcome to Nepal and in particular Kathmandu. If time allows we will have a short city tour today, however it depends on the arrival times of all of the clients booked on the trip. However Thamel is safe to walk around and with a large selection of restaurants your guide can point you in the right direction for your evening meal, alternatively you can rest and prepare for the long car journey tomorrow morning to get to Lantang district. Depending on the time we arrive back into Kathmandu on the final day of the trip we will look to conduct some sightseeing around the city and show you some of the better known sites such as Boudnath Stupa, which is the largest Buddhist stupa in the world and a very important place for Nepalese Buddhists. We will then visit the hilltop temples at Swayambunath that are dedicated to Hanuman the monkey god n Hindu mythology; alongside the playful macaques the views over Kathmandu are worth the long climb up alone. We then visit the historical Royal palaces and temples of the bustling Durbur Square.

Kathmandu to Langtang District This morning you will be collected from the hotel after breakfast and transported around 3 hours north towards the Langtang district of Nepal in our own vehicle. On arrival we will either set up the camp or check into the local guest house (depending on what is recommended by the local guide (based on clouded leopard sightings)) we will head out into the forest with the local ranger and Mike to try and locate some wildlife, including clouded leopards. We can also go out after dark looking, however many of the sightings are made during the day, so we will focus during the day, but also there will be some spotlighting offered each night.

Langtang District - Kathmandu This morning is your last opportunity to explore the forests here looking for wildlife, before we depart and leave in our private vehicle and head back to Kathmandu. On arrival back in the city you will be taken to the same accommodation as on the first day here and if we arrive in time and you would like we can look to do some sightseeing if you wish, such as visiting Boudnath Stupa, Swayambunath and Durbar Square; however the time of arrival into Kathmandu will dictate that and this sightseeing trip would be extra and arranged with the accommodation.
Home This morning you will have a private transfer arranged for you to get you to the airport in order to catch your return flight home or onward to your next destination.

generalInfo:
Nagarkot, a small resort hill station in the Kathmandu Valley, offers some of the best views of the surrounding Himalayan Mountain Range. Outdoors enthusiasts flock to this mountain outpost not only for the views, but also for the serenity. Here thick pine forests and verdant valleys offering plenty of hiking opportunities will surround travelers. Those interested in trekking should consider hiking back out of Nagarkot to Kathmandu or even hike on to their next destination.

Located 20 miles (32 kilometers) from Kathmandu, Nagarkot can be enjoyed as a long day trip, or better yet, an overnight getaway so you can watch the sunrise light up the surrounding peaks. If you can withstand the cold, a visit between October and March almost guarantees clear skies and views as far as the peak of Mt Everest. The monsoons of June, July and September bring clouds and obstructed views at best.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Kathmandu - It is a panoramic thrill flying into Kathmandu on a clear day. The views of snow-capped mountain peaks sprawling down below you are almost ecstatic, beginning a whole chain of memorable experiences that stay with you for a long, long time. A representative and driver from our office will meet you at the airport and escort you to your hotel. The representative will help you check into your designated hotel. At the hotel you will be briefed about your daily activities.Dinner and night stay in Hotel in Kathmandu.

Kathmandu sightseeing - After an early breakfast, you are ready to do sightseeing tour in 4 major places in Kathmandu - Swoyambhunath (Monkey temple), Boudhanath, Pashupatinath, and Kathmandu durbar squire. We begin today's sightseeing tour with a visit to Swoyambhunath a 2500-year old site where, it is believed, the Radiant Lotus of the valley-mythology, settled when the water was drained by Manjushri, the god of Wisdom. The 5 dhyani Buddha's attended by their consorts are enshrined at the base of the stupa. (Non-Hindus are not allowed inside Swayambhunath temple) then continues tour into Boudhanath it is the world,s largest stupa and of Tibetan Buddhist Culture in Nepal. Antique shops where you can buy things of your interest relating to Buddhist surrounded the monastery. After Boudhanath your next spot is The Pashupatinath temple stands along the side of Bagmati River. It is the holiest Temple for Hindus. Many people from different part of Asia visit this Temple. Temple dedicated to lord Shiva, is also a site for Hindu cremation. During the festival Shiva Ratri temple crowed by devotees. Afternoon visit Kathmandu durbar squire, Hanuman Dhoka, the ancient royal residential quarter, Mahadev and Parvati Temple, Machhender Bahl-holy place for the Buddhists and Hindus, Temple House of Kumari, the vestal virgin or the living goddess. Walk around the local bazaars then drive to Hotel.Dinner and night stay in Hotel in Kathmandu.

Sightseeing tour around Patan and Bhaktapur - After breakfast we take you to drive you to Patan durbar squire to explore Patan Durbar Square, Mahaboudha Temple, Kumbeshwor temple, Krishna Temple, Golden Temple and many other places of Patan, you feel as if Patan has been unveiled before you as an open museum showcasing intricately carved windows, intrinsic roof struts, statues of gods and goddesses, temples designed in pagoda style with erotic carvings and repoussé metalwork facades and many other exquisite facets. You will also get to see handicraft centre in Patan and continue drive to Bhaktapur old durbar squire where you will witness unique culture and finest display of craftsmanship. Bhaktapur is the only place in Nepal which has remained untouched by western culture. Lion Gate, Golden Gate, Art Gallery, Statue of King Bhupatindra, Nyatapola Temple and fifty-five windowed Malla Palace are the living prides of Bhaktapur and you will tour around all these places then drive you to Nagarkot hotel.Dinner and night stay in Hotel in Nagarkot .

Nagarkot drive to Kathmandu - Morning witness sunrise at Nagarkot, small village seat at about 7500 Ft altitude, offering fine views from Dhaulagiri in the west, to Kanchenjunga in the east. On a fine day one can even see the tip of the Everest from here. Later depart for Kathmandu and on arrival check in at hotel. Afternoon you are free to shop or relax.Dinner and night stay in Hotel in Kathmandu.
Departure - In the morning, after breakfast our guide and driver will see you off at the airport for your onward flight.

tourName: Kathmandu to Lhasa overland tour, 15 days
generalInfo:
Experience the Himalayas like never before with our exclusive Nepal and Tibet overland adventure. This unique journey is carefully crafted to offer you a perfect blend of cultural immersion, natural wonders, and spiritual exploration. Here's why this tour stands out and why you should join us:

1. Himalayan Bliss and Spiritual Encounters:
Prepare to be awe-struck by the surreal beauty of the Himalayan landscapes that unfold before your eyes. From the verdant valleys of Nepal to the majestic plateaus of Tibet, each vista is a masterpiece of nature's artistry. As you traverse the Himalayan foothills, immerse yourself in the spirituality that permeates the air, visiting ancient monasteries, temples, and sacred sites. Feel the serenity and tranquility as you engage in meditation and immerse yourself in the profound teachings of Tibetan Buddhism.

2. Cultural Richness and Authenticity:
Our journey takes you deep into the heart of Nepali and Tibetan cultures, where you'll witness age-old traditions that have withstood the test of time. Interact with warm and friendly locals, and indulge in traditional cuisine that tantalizes your taste buds with its rich flavors and unique spices. Be part of local festivities, colorful rituals, and dance performances that will leave you captivated.

3. Exploring the Forbidden City - Lhasa:
The highlight of this tour is the enchanting city of Lhasa, known as the "Forbidden City" for centuries. Unlock the secrets of Lhasa as you explore the iconic Potala Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and the heart of Tibetan spirituality. Wander through Barkhor Street, filled with bustling markets and shops, and soak in the spiritual ambiance at the Jokhang Temple, a revered pilgrimage site.

4. Yamdrok Lake and Shigatse's Grandeur:
Discover the azure beauty of Yamdrok Lake, one of Tibet's most sacred lakes, reflecting the towering peaks of the surrounding mountains. Capture moments of serenity amid the pristine landscape, perfect for photography enthusiasts. In Shigatse, marvel at the grandeur of the Tashilhunpo Monastery, a spiritual center and seat of the Panchen Lama.

Embark on this once-in-a-lifetime Nepal and Tibet overland adventure that promises to leave you transformed. Immerse yourself in the allure of the Himalayas, where spirituality, culture, and nature intertwine to create an experience like no other. Join us and be part of this extraordinary expedition, discovering the essence of the Himalayan mystique.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Kathmandu, a city that beckons you to dive into its rich heritage and immerse yourself in the charm of the Himalayas. Your journey through Nepal begins here, and you are about to unravel the secrets of this captivating land, creating memories that will stay with you forever. Get ready to be inspired, enlightened, and embraced by the heartwarming spirit of Kathmandu! We meet you at the airport and transport you to your hotel. In the evening we meet for a welcome dinner, meet the team and brief the tour. Overnight in hotel; meals: D

Prepare to be transported back in time as you explore Kathmandu's UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The Durbar Squares of Kathmandu, Patan, and Bhaktapur are adorned with awe-inspiring palaces, temples, and intricate woodwork, reflecting the city's royal history. Boudhanath Stupa and Swayambhunath (the Monkey Temple) are iconic symbols of Buddhism, radiating spirituality and peace. We visit as many sights as possible throughout the tour. Overnight in hotel in Kathmandu; meals: B

Your journey begins with a scenic drive from Kathmandu to Dhulikhel, a charming hill station renowned for its panoramic views of the Himalayas. Enjoy the refreshing mountain air and breathtaking landscapes along the way. Upon reaching Dhulikhel, check into your cozy accommodation with stunning mountain vistas. After a delicious local lunch, embark on a leisurely stroll through the quaint town. Admire the traditional Newari architecture, intricately carved windows, and temples dotting the narrow alleys. As the sun starts to set, head to one of the many viewpoints in Dhulikhel to witness a mesmerizing sunset over the Himalayas. The golden hues painting the snow-capped peaks create a captivating sight. Overnight in Dhulikhel; meals: B, L, D

After breakfast, drive to the enchanting Balthali Village. Nestled amidst terraced fields and lush greenery, Balthali offers a serene escape from the city bustle. Explore the village on a pleasant walk, interacting with friendly locals and witnessing their traditional lifestyle. In the afternoon, embark on a short drive to Namobuddha, a sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site. Explore the stunning monastery perched on a hilltop and learn about the legend of the compassionate prince who offered himself to a starving tigress. Experience the serenity and spirituality of the place. Head back to Balthali and relax in your charming accommodation. Savor a delectable dinner, prepared with fresh local ingredients, while enjoying the tranquility of the surroundings. Overnight in Balthali; meals: B, L, D

After breakfast, drive to the historical town of Panauti, known for its well-preserved Newari architecture and cultural heritage. Embark on a guided heritage walk through the town's cobbled streets, passing ancient temples, shrines, and traditional houses. Indulge in a traditional Newari lunch in Panauti before bidding farewell to this picturesque town. Then, head back to Kathmandu, reminiscing about the captivating experiences of the past two days.

Our representative will pick you up from your hotel in Kathmandu in the morning and then we will drive through a small mountain road to the border at Nepalese side; on the way you can enjoy the waterfall, river, gorges, and forest. Finally, we will arrive at Nepal Tibet newly opened Kerung border. Our Tibetan guide and driver will pick you up at the border and make the necessary immigration paperwork and then continue driving to Kerung town at a distance of 20km. Overnight in Kerung town. Meals: B

After breakfast, you will start your journey to new Tingri; passing by the most sacred cave of Milarepa Yogi which dates back to the 11th century and also the birthplace of Milarepa. Continue driving through Gong Thang la pass at the elevation of over 5000m and then drive along Pekutso Lake and advance to old Tingri at the distance of around 100 km from Pekutso. The scenery is extremely beautiful with Shisha Bangma Snow Mountain on the right and Pekutso on the left. If the weather is nice, you will see Mount Everest on the way to old Tingri. You will continue driving on the friendship highway and reach new Tingri after a one-hour drive. Overnight in Tingri; meals: B

After tasty breakfast we start driving at around 9:30am from your hotel and drive through big mountain passes, Gyatso la, 5200m and Tsola 4500m and some beautiful villages. You will have your lunch at Shigatse and then head for the sightseeing of Tashi Lhunpo monastery. Overnight in Shigatse; Meals: B

Breakfast always comes first thing in the morning and then we make our final drive Lhasa via 3 big mountain passes, Simi La, Karo La, Kampa La, respectively. Karo La is the highest pass among them that is over 5000m with its most beautiful glaciers; beautiful Yamdrok Lake emerged as coral color from the top of Kampala pass. You will have your lunch at Nakartse country, which is just between the Yamdrok Lake and Karola glaciers. Overnight in Lhasa; Meals: B

You'll spend whole 3 days to explore the capital of Tibet in a walking tours with local guides: Jokhang Temple (most sacred and important temple in Tibet), Barkhor Street and Bazar (Barkhor Street is a very ancient round street surrounding the Jokhang Temple), Potala Palace (a former residence of Dalai Lama until 14th Dalai Lama before he left to India), original Dropenling Handicraft Center and workshop. You can get their unique products and of high quality, made using traditional techniques. Norbulingka Palace, the largest man made palace in Tibet. And so many more. Overnights in Lhasa; Meals: B

Bid farewell to Lhasa as you embark on your journey back to Kathmandu. Relish the memories of your Tibet overland adventure as you cross back into Nepal. The scenic drive will offer one last glimpse of the mesmerizing Himalayas before you return to Kathmandu, where the tour concludes. Overnight in hotels; meals: B

After a hearty breakfast, take some time to stroll through the streets of Kathmandu one last time. Absorb the vibrant energy of the city and savor the final moments of your Nepal and Tibet overland adventure. Souvenir Shopping: Don't miss the opportunity to pick up souvenirs and mementos from Kathmandu's bustling markets. Purchase handicrafts, traditional textiles, prayer flags, and other keepsakes to remind you of your incredible journey. We will transfer you to the airport 3 hours prior departure. Conclusion: Your Nepal and Tibet overland adventure might have come to an end, but the memories and connections forged will stay with you forever. The beauty of these mystical lands, the spirituality of their people, and the grandeur of the Himalayas will continue to inspire and resonate within you. Until we meet again, may the spirit of the Himalayas be your guide on future journeys, enriching your life with its timeless charm. Safe travels and Namaste!

tourName: Kathmandu to Lhasa overland tour, 9 days
placesVisited: Road trip from Kathmandu, Extraordinary Himalayan views, Langtang National Park, Gyirong, visit Everest Base Camp, Shigatse, Three nights in Lhasa, Tibetan guide
generalInfo:
Travel west from Kathmandu to Tibet on the scenic Friendship Highway via Tingri and Shigatse. Along this unforgettable path, you'll be treated to breathtaking vistas of snowcapped mountains, vast glaciers, and serene sacred lakes – plus, get a close encounter with Everest.

Your journey starts in Kathmandu, before taking the Friendship Highway, a beautiful 800km road connecting the Nepal capital to Lhasa. Once you cross into Tibet, you’ll make a stop at Everest Base Camp on the Tibet side, before continuing on to finish your trip in Lhasa.

What’s great about this trip is the landscapes. As well as EBC, you’ll be crossing high Himalaya passes like Gawu La Pass (5,198m) and Kambala Pass (4,794m). From here, you get panoramas of some of the highest mountains in the world – peaks soaring over 8,000m, including Everest, Lhotse and Makalu.

You’ll also have many cultural encounters. In Lhasa, you’ll spend three nights getting to know the city, from the historic sights of Potala Palace and Drepung Monastery, to no less memorable encounters with the people of the city.

Everest Base Camp is a busy tourist site and this holiday makes every effort to minimise your impact here, travelling in a bus rather than creating more congestion in a private car. At all times you’ll be accompanied by an expert guide – in Tibet, this will be a local Tibetan guide, who can give you unparalleled insight on your travels, whether finding the best family-run restaurants, or ensuring your safety and comfort at altitude.

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu to Syabrubesi || Your driver will pick you up in your hotel about 9:00-9:30 am. Then you will drive to the Sino-Nepal border area, near to Tibet. While driving near Mt.Himalayas, you can see the deep gorges, snow-capped mountains on the way. You will also drive across the LuangTang National Park. And finally stay overnight in village guest house in Syabrubesi.

Syabrubesi to Kyirong || After breakfast, you will drive 15km to the border to enter China. You will meet our guide in China side. Then we will drive 1 hour to Kyirong (2800m) where is surrounded by lofty snow-capped mountains and dense forests. In the afternoon, you take a stroll to visit Paba Temple (2850m), a Gelugpa temple built by Tibetan King Songtsan Gambo at the proposal of his wife Nepali princess Bhrikuti. The Nepali style temple with delicate murals is only within minutes, walk from your hotel.

Gyirong to EBC || Today, we will first pass through Peikutso Lake and grassland, and then we arrive the Everest Base Camp and visit the world highest Monastery, the Rongbuk Monastery. On the way, you can view the splendid panoramic Himalayan Mountain Range at Gawu La Pass (5198m). After visiting Everest Base Camp, we will drive to Tingri. Zhufeng Road over the Gawu La Pass (5250m) from which you get an amazing view of the Himalayan panorama. The view of the peaks includes several mountains above 8000 meters including Mount Everest (8848m) Mt. Lhotse (8516m) Mt. Makalu (8463m) Mt. Shishapangma (8020m) and Mt. Cho Oyu (8201m).

EBC - Shigatse || Today, we will drive from Tingri to Shigatse. On the way, you will visit the 5000m G318 National Highway milestone in Lhatse. After your arrival in Shigatse in the early afternoon, you will visit the seat of Panchen Lama - Tashilunpo Monastery, one of the most important monasteries in Tibet. It is the seat of the Panchen Lama before heading off along the Friendship Highway towards Lhasa. Built in 1447 by the first Dalai Lama, the monastery is now the traditional seat of the Panchen Lama Tibet’s second highest religious incarnation. There you will be able to see the tombs of 7 Panchen Lamas, explore the twisting cobbled streets and get a peek into monastic life.

Shigatse to Lhasa via Gyantse || In the morning, drive 90km to Gyantse, an ancient county between Shigatse and Lhasa, which boasts a variety of important cultural and historical sites - Gyantse Kumbum) and Gyantse Dzong. In the afternoon, drive 280km to Lhasa, and we will pass over the Karo la Pass (5010m) and Kambala Pass (4794m). While driving you will see the beautiful Karo la Glacier, Yamdrotso Lake (Truquoise Lake) and Brahmaputra River and finally reach Lhasa.

Lhasa tour || After breakfast, you will go to visit Drepung Monastery which is used as Dalai Lama’s palace before they moves to the Potala Palace. In the afternoon, visit Sera Monastery, one of the “three great Gelug monasteries of Tibet”. The highlight is the monks’ debate at around 3-5pm.

Lhasa tour || Today, you will visit the Potala Palace, winter palace of the Dalai Lama. It contains the gilded burial stupas of past Dalai Lamas and meditation Cave of the 33rd great king of Tibet. After lunch, you head to Jokhang temple. Inside you can see the statue of Buddha Sakyamuni at the age of twelve, perhaps the single most venerated object in Tibet Buddhism. Around the temple Barkhor street where you can do kora( circle religious sites) with pilgrims and locals, and you can buy the souvenirs.
Depart from Lhasa || You will be accompanied with tour guide to airport/train station by private car, see good-bye and end the trip.

generalInfo: This is one of the most adventurous and challenging 4WD wheels driving adventure trip, taking you over exotic remote terrain. It provides to experience of thrilling driving through a unique virgin off road tracks with stunning views of Annapurna Himalayan ranges including Annapurna South, Dhaulagiri Mountain, Machhapuchhre (Fishtail), and Tukuche Peak, Nilgiri Peak, Dhampus Peak and other more snowy peaks. It gives also an excellent chance to converse with local people and experience of their customs and traditional lifestyles.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Tribhuvan International Airport, Kathmandu; meet with our tour coordinator at the arrival complex of airport, then transfer to hotel.
Explore Kathmandu.
Breakfast at hotel, then scenic drive to Pokhara for 06 hours approximately, the city natural beauty. Check into hotel.

After breakfast drive to Tukuche village 2590 m. through beautiful stoned walled villages of Gasha, Kala Panai that offers excellent views of Dhaulagiri I (8167 m), Annapurna I (8091 m), Dhampus Peak and beautiful valley can be seen on the way tour. En-route explores Kobang (2560m), a famous village in Mustang district and it is separated from Larjung villages by a small stream. This is a religious and ancestral significance for four Thakkalai clans Gauchan, Tulachan, Sherchan and Bhattachan who believe that their founding ancestors first came to this village. Each clan has its own animal deity- Gauchan (Elephant), Tulachan (Sea monster), Sharechan (Lioness) and Bhattachan (Yak). Explore Tukuche village, it means Land of Abundant Grain. It was very famous place in the ancient time for Tibetan and Nepalese people exchanged salt with grain. In this village, most of the houses are built in the classic Thakali style-flat roofed with carved windows and balconies and a courtyard at the centre of the houses to give the protection from wind. Visit Mahakala Monastery, founded in 1930, located at heart of heart of the Tukuche. It takes its name from the fierce mal deity / Kuyper Gomba, the Nyingmapa sect monastery.

Breakfast at lodge, then drive to Muktinath 3710m, a famous Temple for Hindus and Buddhist devotees. 108 holy water spouts wall is standing on the rocks, the water came out from where. The main Temple of Vishnu, God of protector stands in the complex, below the Bodhisattva statue runs a trickling flow of water with pale flames which is caused by natural gas and its burning, the sacred place for Buddhist and Hindus devotees. In the complex, Monastery of Padmasambhava, Shiva and Parvati shrine stand. It provides amazing views of snowy mountains including Dhaulagiri Mountain (8167m). Overnight at trekking lodge in Muktinath.

Breakfast at hotel and then scenic drive through beautiful village’s terrain to Tatopani (hot spring) village, 1190 meter situated River bank of Kaligandaki. It provides excellent views of Nilgiri Mountain and beautiful landscape. You can enjoy with natural hot spring at River bank of Kaligandaki. Overnight at trekking lodge in Tatopani Village.
After breakfast, drive to Pokhara and check into hotel.
After breakfast visit Peace Stupa and Dave's falls and then back to hotel.

After breakfast drive from Pokhara to Chitwan National Park, probably the best Park of South Asia for wildlife safari and check into Resort. After lunch visit Tharu village and you can enjoy with Tharu culture program at evening.

Full-day Jungle Excursion such as Jeep safari for viewing of great one horned rhinoceroses , sloth bears, four types deers, two types of crocodiles, Royal Bengal Tigers, leopards etc. Canoeing tour on river for viewing of crocodiles and Jungle walk back to Resort.

Early morning our well trained and experience Naturalist takes you into prime spot for birds watching, you can experience more than 450 specises of extoic birds on the trip and walk back to Resort. After breakfast drive to Kathmandu and check into hotel.
Farewell You will be leaving with memory of adventurous journey of the life time. We will make sure to turn the days to your most memorable moments of life.

generalInfo:
A beautiful natural Tour of the Best of Nepal:
This is an easy-paced tour through the best of Nepal in a small-scale and authentic travel way, covering Kathmandu, Bhaktapur, Chitwan National Parc, Pokhara and Nagarkot. You will be able to admire both the areas of the Annapurnas and Mt Everest. Each tour is handpicked and a unique experience is created for the discerning traveller to suit your tastes. We recognize Tours not simply as a visit, but as an amalgamation of rich and varied experiences for all.

Includes:

- All arrivals / departures in an AC vehicle with an English Speaking Guide
- 2 night’s stay at hotel in Kathmandu on Twin Room Sharing with bed and breakfast basis
- 2 night’s stay at hotel in Chitwan on Twin Sharing with all meals, all jungle activities basis
- 2 night’s stay at hotel in Pokhara on Twin Room Sharing with bed and breakfast basis
- 1 night stay at hotel in Nagarkot on Twin Room Sharing with breakfast & dinner basis
- Sightseeing tour of Kathmandu with an English speaking guide throughout the tour including all monument fees
- Driving from Chitwan to Pokhara in an A/C vehicle as per the group size with an English speaking guide
- Sightseeing tour of Pokhara with an English speaking guide throughout the tour including all monument fees
- Hiking from Pokhara to Peace with an English speaking guide
- Welcome dinner at a Local restaurant with a cultural dance in Kathmandu
- Mineral water during drives and sightseeing tour
- English speaking guide throughout the tour

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu arrival. Assistance and transfer to the hotel for refreshment and rest. Evening: Welcome dinner at a Nepali restaurant with a cultural dance. Overnight at hotel in Kathmandu. (4 Star Barhi Hotel or 5 Star Yak and Yeti)
Kathmandu: After breakfast, proceed for the sightseeing tour of Kathmandu including Kathmandu Durbar Square, Swoyambhunath Stupa & Patan Durbar Square. Overnight at your hotel in Kathmandu.

Chitwan: After breakfast, transfer to Kathmandu Domestic Airport for onwards flight to Chitwan (Bharatpur) - 20min. Upon arrival in Chitwan transfer to the jungle lodge. Upon arrival in your jungle lodge have lunch and proceed for the jungle activities. Dinner and overnight at jungle lodge in Chitwan (4 Star Soaltee Westend or 5 Star Barhi Jungle Lodge)

Chitwan: Full day jungle acitivites in Chitwan. Dinner and overnight at jungle lodge in Chitwan. (Jungle activities in Chitwan can be: Jungle walk, Canoeing, Jeep Safari, etc. Kindly note that the activities in Chitwan are subject to change as per the rules of the jungle lodge and season).

Pokhara: After breakfast, start drive to Pokhara (5 hours) Upon arrival in Pokhara check into the hotel for refreshment and rest. Later proceed for the sightseeing tour of Pokhara including Davis Fall, Gupteswor Mahadev & Bindyabasini Temple. Evening: Boatride at Phewa lake and visit Barahi Temple situated at the middle of the lake. Overnight at hotel in Pokhara (4 Star Atithi Resort & Spa or 5 Star Fishtail Lodge)

Pokhara: After breakfast, we begin our hike with a relaxing 30 minutes boat ride to the other side of Phewa lake. A gentle 1.5 hour hike takes you to the Peace Pagoda. This Peace Pagoda was constructed by Buddhist monks from Japan to promote world peace. From here, you can see the entire Pokhara valley along with great views of Phewa Lake and the Annapurna Range etc. Later drive back to the hotel. Rest of the day is free for your own shopping, sightseeing etc. Or you can participate in different Adventure activities such as Paragliding, Zip lining, Bungy Jump, Ulta Light etc. Overnight at hotel in Pokhara

Nagarkot: After breakfast, transfer to Pokhara Airport for onwards flight to Kathmandu – 25 Min. Upon arrival in Kathmandu drive to Nagarkot – 1.5 hours. En route proceed for the sightseeing tour of Bhaktapur City. After sightseeing tour, continue drive to Nagarkot. Upon arrival in Nagarkot check into the hotel for rest. Enjoy rest of the day having fascinating views of Mt. Langtang, Mt. Everest, Mt. Ganesh etc. Dinner and overnight at your hotel in Nagarkot. (4 Star Country Villa or 5 Star Club Himalaya)

Early morning wake up to the sunrise view of the Himalayan Range – subject to weather permitting, breakfast at the hotel and later timely transfer to the Kathmandu Tribhuvan International Airport for onwards flight.

placesVisited: Annapurna, Mountain biking in Kathmandu Valley and Nagarkot, Pokhara, White water rafting on Trisuli River, Paragliding over villages, lakes and monasteries, Mountain tea-house stay, Bhaktapur, Holy site of Namobudha
generalInfo:
This active small group adventure combines pulse-quickening activities with a chance to explore ancient cities and traditional villages amid Himalayan vistas of soaring peaks and beautiful lakes.

You'll get to discover the Kathmandu Valley on a mountain bike, riding superb dirt trails through exotic hills and woods. You'll also get a chance to experience stunning aerial views of the Himalayas paragliding with expert fliers in control as you share airspace with Himalayan griffin vulture, eagles and kites, while drifting over exotic villages, monasteries, temples and lakes framed by magical peaks.

From a resort base in Nagarkot, hop on the mountain bikes again to roam traditional villages and farm terraces, plus atmospheric pine and Rhododendron forest. You'll also go rafting from Pokhara, whooshing down the Trisuli River through grade 2-3 rapids.

There's trekking too, with a fabulous forest walk to the Australian Camp at the foot of the iconic mountain, Annapurna – where you'll stay at a traditional tea house with stupendous views of the Machhapuchare range.

Cultural explorations include sightseeing in Kathmandu plus the lovely lakeside city of Pokhara and wood-carving mecca of Bhaktapur. There's also a visit to Namobudha – the sacred Buddhist spot where Lord Buddha reputedly saved the life of starving tiger by sharing his own flesh.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival Kathmandu airport and transfer to hotel. Prior to landing in the Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, you could have some excellent views of snowy mountains, after customs clearance, you will meet with our tour coordinator at arrival complex and transfer to hotel.

Sightseeing in Kathmandu: After breakfast, drive to Swayambhunanth Stupa, locally known as Monkey Temple, situated lush Kathmandu hills that provides exotic views of Kathmandu valley, then drive to Bhaktapur , the city examples of wood -craving. The Durbar square covered by full of historical monuments and beautiful art. Then drive to Nagarkot and check into Resort.

Mountain bike tour from Nagarkot: After breakfast , commence mountain bike tour through a beautiful agriculture terrace, typical villages, and Pine and Rhododendron forest. You can enjoy with natural beauty, spectacular views of snowy mountains and beautiful typical villages and a great chance to chat with local people and experience of local customs during the trip. Overnight at Kathmandu.

Drive from Kathmandu to Rafting put in point Rafting and After rafting drive to Pokhara. After breakfast drive to Charudi (rafting put in point), commence exhilarating river rafting on Trisuli River, enjoy with exciting 2-3 grade rapids, after lunch drive to Pokahara. Enjoy with Nature beauty in Pokhara.

Annapurna comfort trek Trek from Pokahra to Australian Camp After breakfast drive to Phedi ( trekking starting point), commence trek through rhododendron forest and beautiful valley you will reach at Dhampus that presenting the excellent views of Annapurna south, Himchuli, Machhapuchare Himalayan ranges and gradual hike up to Australian Camp and stay at Tea house.

Trek from Australian Camp to Sarangkot 1950m. After breakfast, commence trek through beautiful valley and rhododendron forest and reach at Sarangkot. Stay at Lodge. Early morning from the summit of Sarangkot provides beautiful sunrise views over the Himalayan ranges and glimpse of Pokahra valley.

Experience Paragliding from Sarangkot to Pokahra. After breakfast, Take a paragliding with expert crews where you can enjoy incredible views of Annapurna Himalayan ranges and beautiful views of Pokahra valley and after landing in Pokahra and transfer to hotel in Pokhara. Enjoy with Nature beauty.
Scenic drive from Pokhara to Kathmandu. Early morning scenic drive from Pokahra to Kathamndu and check into hotel.
Day Excursion to Namobudha. It is a very famous sacred place for Buddhist devotees, where Lord Buddha saved the life of tiger dying from hunger by giving him his flesh, then drive back to Kathamndu.
Departure to Kathmandu airport.

generalInfo:
Nepal is one of the most stunning and beautiful Himalayan countries in the world, offering unparalleled opportunities for adventure enthusiasts. Our adventure activity holidays cater to travelers seeking unique experiences that are often exclusive to Nepal. Each special trip focuses on a specific activity, often tied to a particular region, ensuring guests can enjoy the most authentic and exciting experiences tailored to their preferences. With years of expertise, we specialize in crafting the best adventure options to suit our guests’ needs.

In addition to our curated activity holidays, we offer a wide range of thrilling adventure sports, including mountain flights, river rafting, paragliding, ultralight flights, zip-lining, bungee jumping, and hiking. Each activity is designed to provide adventure seekers with a truly fulfilling and unforgettable experience in the heart of the Himalayas.

Imagine soaring through the skies alongside Himalayan griffin vultures, eagles, and kites, floating over picturesque villages, monasteries, temples, lakes, and jungles—all while taking in breathtaking views of the majestic Himalayan peaks. Experience the adrenaline rush of a 160-meter bungee jump into a dramatic gorge, the exhilaration of navigating strong rapids while river rafting, or the thrill of a paragliding flight that offers a bird’s-eye view of Nepal’s magnificent mountains.

For a softer adventure, enjoy a hike to Ghorepani Poonhill, where you’ll be rewarded with stunning panoramic views of the Himalayas. These adventures promise a perfect blend of excitement, natural beauty, and unforgettable memories, making your trip to Nepal truly extraordinary.

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu Arrival. Meet us at Kathmandu Airport, transfer to hotel. Rest. Overnight stay in hotel.

Kathmandu - Rafting - Pokhara After breakfast, Drive to Pokhara. On the way to Pokhara, stop at Chauradi for 2-3 hours white water rafting, start rafting in Trishuli River, run through the rapids, lunch on the beach somewhere. Continue drive to Pokhara. Overnight stay in hotel.

Pokhara - Kushma Bungee (world’s second-highest) After breakfast, scenic drive to Kushma from Pokhara (approx. 2 hours’ drive). You will experience the thrill of the Kushma Bungee, Nepal’s highest bungee and the world’s second-highest bungee Jump. You can choose adventure activities if you like; Bungee Jump, Swing Jump, Tandem swing, Sky Cycling, Sky Gliding, Wasting Hand, Family Ping, Sky Cafe and Zipline. Later on, you can explore longest suspension bridges in Kushma. Overnight stay in the Cliff Resort.

Kushma - Beni - Ghorepani After breakfast, Drive to Ghorepani via Beni. On the way stop at Tatopani for Natural Hot Spring. After hot spring continue drive to Ghorepani via gravel road. Overnight stay in Lodge/teahouse.

Ghorepani - PoonHill - Ghorepani - Pokhara Wake up early morning, have tea/coffee then climb up Poon hill (3210m./10593 ft.) 45 minutes’ walk with day pack to see the Sunrise and Panoramic view of Mt. Annapurna and Dhaulagiri with fishtail and other mountains. After breakfast, drive to Pokhara. Overnight stay in hotel.
