Pokhara After breakfast, boating at Phewa Lake and visit Barahi Temple. In the morning Paragliding Tour, which is a great way to have a bird eye view of the beautiful Mountains, Pokhara and the nearby hills. Later on, you can do any optional activities on your own choices; Cable car to visit Sarangkot, Ultralight Flight Tour, Zip Flying, Skydiving etc. Afternoon, half day visit David’s fall, Mahadev Cave, Seti River George, Mountain Museum etc. Overnight stay in hotel.

Pokhara - Kathmandu (Approx. 6 hours’ drive) After breakfast, scenic drive back to Kathmandu (approx. 6 hours’ drive). Afternoon, free for personal activities. In the late afternoon, we will take you to Nepali Cultural Restaurant for farewell dinner with typical musical show. Overnight stay in hotel.
Departure Early morning Everest Scenic Mountain flight (free for optional activity) After breakfast, Free till departure. Transfer to Airport. Fly back to Home.

placesVisited: Kathmandu, Bhaktapur (Dubar Square), Nagarkot, Sunrise view over the Himalayas, Patan city, Kathmandu temples & stupas, Trishuli River, Chitwan national park, Full day safari (possible sightings of tigers & rhinos), Pokhara, Boating on Phewa lake, Annapurna panorama, 3 day trek Australian Camp, Overnight in tea houses/lodges, Pokhara city sightseeing, Seti River gorge, Mahendra Gufa, Lakeside Markets
generalInfo:
Beginning in Kathmandu, you will immerse yourself in Nepali life with two days of locally-guided city sightseeing. You will take in temples, stupa's (including Boudhanat - the largest in Nepal) and nearby Bhaktapur with its artisans, narrow alleyways, and community centric courtyards before heading back to Kathamandu and Patan city to see some of the finest palaces and temples in the whole of Nepal.

It is then time to leave city life behind for the wilds of the royal Chitwan national park, stopping off to test your adventurous side riding the chutes and bends of the Trishuli River rapids on the way. In Chitwan, you'll have a full day safari in the park which is one of the best places in Nepal for spotting rhinos, tigers and leopards in the wild. Leave space on your memory card because you will now head to Pokhara, one of the most picturesque parts of Nepal with its beautiful lake and magnificent reflections of Machhapuchhare (Fishtail Peak) and the Annapurna range.

No trip to Nepal would be complete without pulling on the walking boots and heading out on a trek and so we've included a three day hike to the vista-blessed Australian camp, staying in tea houses and lodges along the way. The trails are seriously scenic, passing through sub tropical valleys, rhododendron forests, charming villages and terrace farms inhabited by the local Gurung and Magars. Reaching the camp before dark, you will watch the sun set over stunning views of the Himalayas - a real highlight of the tour.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Kathmandu: Arrive at Tribhuwan International Airport, Kathmandu, you are welcomed by the hospitable meeting and then you will be transferred to your hotel. Overnight at Hotel.

Kathmandu: After breakfast, full day valley sightseeing with Kathmandu Durbar Square, the place of the Malla and then the Shah Kings of Nepal, visiting Kumari Temple, house of the virgin goddess, visiting Swoyambhunath, a stupa on the top of hill - from here you can overlook the scenery of Kathmandu, Visiting Patan city, the second largest town in the valley, Krishna Mandir, Golden Temple etc.. Overnight at Hotel.

Kathmandu - Nagarkot After breakfast, we will take you a glimpse of half day sightseeing tour in Kathmandu Valley; Pashupatinath Temple, one of the most important Hindu temple in Nepal. We keep going for walk to see the huge of stupa of Buddha, also known as Boudhanath, the largest stupa in Nepal. Afterward taking a ride to Bhaktapur, a fascinating town, visit Bhaktapur's Dubar Square featuring the Victorian illustrations style with temples and temples complex. Keep the route connecting to Nagarkot and stay Overnight at Hotel.

Nagarkot - Rafting - Chitwan: Early morning sunrise view over the Himalayas (weather permitted). After breakfast, we travel overland from Kathmandu to Chitwan National Park. On the way, 02-03 hours rafting at Trishuli River. Continue drive to Chitwan. Overnight at Hotel.

Chitwan: After breakfast, the next, you get a full day safari activities in Royal Chitwan national Park - if you are lucky, you will see many amazing creatures that you spend most time to looking for; rhinoceroses, Chitwan's royal Bengal tigers, leopards, monkeys, many types of deer and reptiles. Check your camera gear - preferably with a telephoto lens and you will not miss any shots. Overnight at Hotel.
Chitwan - Pokhara: After breakfast, we travel overland from Chitwan to Pokhara. Afternoon, boating at Fewa lake. Overnight at Hotel.

Pokhara - Australian Camp After breakfast, drive to Kande, short trek to Australian camp offers stunning views of the Central Himalayas. It is one of the best trek from Pokhara. Everything from the mountains to the villages and terrace farms along the trails of this trek are superbly beautiful. Overnight at teahouses/lodges.

Australian Camp - Pokhara: Early in the morning to catch the sunrise and beautiful Himalayas view. After breakfast, short hiking to Dhampus village and walk down to Phedi. Drive back to Pokhara. On they way stop at Tibetan Refugee Camp where you will have plenty of time to explore monasteries, Buddhist monk school, Buddhist temples, see their hand made manufacturing arts etc.

Pokhara: After breakfast, half day sightseeing of Pokhara city, the most popular destination in Nepal after Kathmandu, spend enjoyably the morning trip along the bank of Phewa Lake, you can admire the stunning view of the Fish Tail's Peak reflected in the silver surface of the water. You can also see the wonderful Annapurna panorama forms a superb backdrop to Pokhara from the lake. Aside from Phewa Lake, we keep visiting the Seti River gorge - one of the best places to see, Mahendra Gufa, used to be well-known for its stalactites. Stay overnight at hotel. In the evening walk around Lakeside Market. Overnight at Hotel.
Pokhara - Kathmandu: After breakfast, Scenic Drive back to Kathmandu. Overnight at Hotel.
Departure: Departure Transfer to airport to connect onward flight.

tourName: Nepal and Tibet cultural tour, 16 days
generalInfo:
Set off on an unforgettable cultural adventure through the majestic Himalayas as you explore the rich heritage and stunning landscapes of Nepal and Tibet. From the vibrant streets of Kathmandu to the sacred monasteries of Lhasa, this journey will take you deep into the spiritual heart of these ancient lands.

Begin your trip in Nepal, a country steeped in tradition and natural beauty. Wander through bustling bazaars and centuries-old temples in the Kathmandu Valley, where Hindu and Buddhist culture come alive with every prayer flag and temple bell. Travel onward to discover the birthplace of Lord Buddha in Lumbini, then embrace the warm hospitality of local communities as you savor authentic Nepali cuisine and explore the diverse landscapes — from lush green hills to the snow-capped peaks of the Annapurna and Everest regions.

Cross into Tibet, often called “The Roof of the World,” where sacred Buddhist sites and jaw-dropping vistas await. Stand in awe before the grandeur of Potala Palace, join local pilgrims on the Barkhor Circuit, and admire the vibrant murals and prayer halls of Jokhang Temple. Venture across the Tibetan Plateau to serene lakes and iconic monasteries perched high in the hills, where prayer flags flutter against a backdrop of endless blue skies.

Your experienced local guides will help you navigate this enchanting region, sharing stories of its rich spiritual traditions and leading you to hidden gems along the way. Whether it’s trekking to Everest Base Camp, exploring remote villages, or witnessing a traditional Tibetan festival, every moment is designed to deepen your connection to these sacred lands.

Along the way, take time to reflect during quiet meditation sessions, savor rich flavors like momos and butter tea, and capture unforgettable sunrise views over the world’s highest peaks. Every interaction — whether with a friendly monk or a local artisan — will leave you with a greater appreciation for Himalayan culture and the gentle rhythm of mountain life.

This is more than a tour; it’s an invitation to slow down, look inward, and embrace the beauty of Nepal and Tibet. Join us on this transformative journey and let the spirit of the Himalayas touch your soul forever.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Kathmandu, the vibrant capital of Nepal! As you arrive, be prepared to be captivated by the city's unique blend of ancient traditions and modern energy. Our team will be waiting to greet you at the airport and escort you to your accommodation. Once you've had some time to rest and refresh, we'll treat you to a delightful welcome dinner at a traditional Newari restaurant. Newars are the indigenous people of the Kathmandu Valley, known for their rich culture and distinct cuisine. Get ready to savor an array of mouthwatering Newari delicacies, including momo (dumplings), yomari (sweet filled pastry), and dal bhat (traditional rice and lentil dish). As you relish the flavors of Nepal, we'll introduce you to your fellow travelers and brief you about the upcoming adventure. This is the perfect opportunity to ask any questions and immerse yourself in the warm Nepali hospitality. Overnight in Kathmandu; meals: D

Today, we embark on a fascinating journey to explore the cultural gems of the Kathmandu Valley. After a delicious breakfast, we'll set out to visit some of the most iconic UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the valley. Our first stop will be at Swayambhunath, also known as the Monkey Temple. This ancient stupa sits atop a hill and offers panoramic views of the entire Kathmandu Valley. Admire the mesmerizing architecture and the serene atmosphere while curious monkeys play around you. Next, we'll head to Boudhanath, one of the largest stupas in Nepal and a significant center of Tibetan Buddhism. Immerse yourself in the spiritual ambiance as you join locals and pilgrims in their traditional circumambulation (kora) around the stupa. After a delightful lunch at a local eatery, we'll continue our journey to Pashupatinath, the holiest Hindu temple in Nepal. Witness the fascinating rituals and ceremonies along the sacred Bagmati River, where Hindu cremations take place. Our final stop for the day will be at Patan Durbar Square, located in the ancient city of Lalitpur. Here, you'll encounter intricate Newari architecture, historic royal palaces, and beautifully crafted temples. Overnight in Kathmandu; meals: B

Today, we have an important task ahead - submitting fingerprints for your Tibet visa at the Chinese embassy. After breakfast, we'll assist you with the necessary arrangements and accompany you to the embassy to ensure a smooth process. Once the visa formalities are complete, we'll embark on a scenic drive to Chitwan National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a wildlife paradise. The journey takes us through picturesque landscapes, lush valleys, and charming villages, providing glimpses of rural life in Nepal. Upon reaching Chitwan, we'll check into our lodge and enjoy a delicious lunch. Chitwan National Park is renowned for its diverse wildlife, including the elusive Bengal tiger, one-horned rhinoceros, and over 500 species of birds. Get ready for an exciting afternoon safari, where we'll explore the park's dense forests and grasslands in search of these majestic creatures. In the evening, we'll unwind with a cultural program featuring traditional Tharu dance, showcasing the vibrant local culture. Get ready for an unforgettable encounter with nature and wildlife! Overnight in Chitwan; meals: B, L, D

After breakfast, we'll embark on an exhilarating jungle safari inside Chitwan National Park. Accompanied by experienced guides, we'll explore the diverse ecosystems, lush vegetation, and spot various wildlife. Keep an eye out for rhinos, deer, monkeys, and an array of bird species in their natural habitat. In the afternoon, we'll take a guided nature walk through the enchanting forests of Chitwan. Our expert naturalists will introduce you to the fascinating flora and fauna of the region, making it an excellent opportunity for birdwatching as well. To enhance our cultural experience, we'll visit a nearby Tharu village. Immerse yourself in the local culture, interact with the welcoming Tharu community, and gain insights into their traditional lifestyle and customs. As the day draws to a close, we'll head to a strategic viewpoint to witness a breathtaking sunset over the beautiful landscapes of Chitwan. The play of colors in the sky promises a captivating sight. Rest assured that our activities in Chitwan respect ethical considerations and focus on nature appreciation and cultural immersion. With the memories of the wilderness and cultural encounters, we'll retreat to our lodge for a peaceful night's rest, ready for more unforgettable experiences in the days to come! Overnight in Chitwan; meals: B, L, D

We start the day with a canoe ride down the serene Rapti River. This is a chance to enjoy the tranquil journey and spot more aquatic life and bird species. After breakfast, bid farewell to Chitwan National Park and its captivating wilderness. We'll begin our journey towards the charming village of Ghandruk, located in the picturesque Annapurna region. As we ascend into the foothills of the Himalayas, be captivated by the ever-changing scenery, passing through terraced fields, quaint villages, and lush forests. Upon reaching Ghandruk, check into your accommodation and take a moment to soak in the breathtaking views of the Annapurna and Machhapuchhre (Fishtail) mountains from the village. Ghandruk is a traditional Gurung village, offering a glimpse into the unique culture and lifestyle of the local community. Take a leisurely stroll through the narrow alleys of Ghandruk, where you'll find traditional stone houses adorned with intricate woodwork. Engage with the friendly locals and learn about their customs, traditions, and daily life. In the evening, head to a vantage point to witness a stunning sunset over the majestic Annapurna and Machhapuchhre mountains. The sight of these towering peaks bathed in golden hues is a truly awe-inspiring moment. As night falls, indulge in a delicious dinner featuring local flavors. Overnight in Ghandruk; meals: B, D

After a hearty breakfast in Ghandruk, take some time to explore the quaint village. Wander through the charming streets, observe the traditional architecture, and interact with the friendly locals. Don't forget to capture the stunning views of the Annapurna and Machhapuchhre mountains surrounding the village. Engage in cultural activities and learn about the unique traditions and lifestyle of the Gurung community. Visit a local Gurung home, where you'll be warmly welcomed and offered insights into their customs and daily life. This intimate experience will provide a deeper understanding of the local culture. In the afternoon, bid farewell to Ghandruk and embark on a scenic drive to Pokhara. The journey offers mesmerizing views of the rolling hills and terraced landscapes. Along the way, we'll make stops at picturesque viewpoints for photo opportunities. In the evening, enjoy a leisurely walk along the bustling Lakeside area. Explore the vibrant streets lined with shops, cafes, and restaurants, and soak in the relaxed ambiance by the shores of Phewa Lake. You can also indulge in a delightful lakeside dinner while enjoying the breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. Overnight in Pokhara; meals: B

After breakfast, embark on a visit to Davis Falls, also known as Patale Chhango, a unique waterfall that disappears into an underground cave. Right next to the falls, explore the Gupteshwor Cave, a mysterious cavern with awe-inspiring limestone formations and hidden shrines. Then we'll visit the World Peace Pagoda, a Buddhist stupa situated atop a hill. The pagoda offers panoramic views of Pokhara city, Phewa Lake, and the Himalayan peaks. Bask in the tranquil ambiance and soak in the spirituality of this serene place. After exploring the World Peace Pagoda, we'll head to Pokhara Airport for a short domestic flight to Kathmandu. The scenic flight offers bird's-eye views of the Himalayan peaks and the lush landscapes of Nepal. Upon arriving in Kathmandu, we'll transfer to your hotel. The rest of the day is your free time to explore the town on your own. Overnight in Kathmandu; meals: B

After breakfast in Kathmandu, we'll begin our journey towards the border town of Kerung, marking the entry point to Tibet. The scenic drive takes us through picturesque landscapes, offering glimpses of rural life in Nepal. Arriving at the Rasuwagadhi border, we'll complete the necessary immigration formalities to cross into Tibet. Our experienced team will assist you throughout the process to ensure a smooth transition. Upon entering Tibet, you'll be greeted by the captivating landscapes and the warm hospitality of the Tibetan people. Take a moment to appreciate the unique cultural ambiance as we continue our drive towards Kerung. Reach the town of Kerung, a delightful place nestled amidst the Himalayas. Check into your accommodation and take some time to rest and acclimatize to the higher altitude. Wander through the charming streets, interact with the locals, and get a glimpse of the Tibetan way of life. Overnight in Kerung; meals: B

Today, we'll embark on an exciting journey from Kerung to Tingri, another captivating destination in Tibet. After breakfast, we'll depart from Kerung and hit the road for Tingri, located amidst the stunning Himalayan landscapes. Experience the vastness of the Tibetan Plateau, a unique and enchanting landscape that extends as far as the eye can see. The rugged terrain and the serene beauty of the plateau will leave you in awe. En route, we'll pass through traditional Tibetan villages, where you can catch glimpses of the local lifestyle and witness the daily activities of the Tibetan people. After a memorable drive, we'll arrive in Tingri. Nestled at an altitude of over 4,300 meters, Tingri offers stunning views of some of the world's highest peaks, including Mount Everest, Cho Oyu, and Makalu. As we reach higher altitudes, it's essential to take some time to acclimatize. We'll check into our accommodation in Tingri, and you can rest and take it easy for the remainder of the day to adapt to the altitude. Overnight in Tingri; meals: B

After breakfast, we'll set out on the road for an unforgettable day ahead. As we leave Tingri behind, be prepared to be mesmerized by the ever-changing scenery of Tibet. The drive to Shigatse offers breathtaking views of snow-capped mountains, vast grasslands, and traditional Tibetan villages. Marvel at the majestic presence of Mount Everest, the highest peak in the world, and soak in the awe-inspiring surroundings. On the way to Everest Base Camp, you can also visit the iconic Rongbuk Monastery, the highest monastery in the world. The spiritual ambiance and panoramic views of the Himalayas make it a memorable stop. Upon reaching Shigatse, Tibet's second-largest city, you'll be greeted by the lively atmosphere and rich Tibetan culture. Check into your hotel and take some time to rest and acclimatize to the altitude. In the afternoon, we'll visit the renowned Tashilhunpo Monastery, one of the most important monasteries in Tibet and the traditional seat of the Panchen Lama. Admire the grand architecture, intricate murals, and sacred relics of this historical monastery. In the evening, enjoy some leisure time in Shigatse. You can choose to explore more of the city, savor traditional Tibetan cuisine, or simply relax and take in the ambiance of this culturally rich destination. Overnight in Shigatse; meals: B

After a hearty breakfast in Shigatse, we'll set out on the road to Lhasa. The drive will take us through captivating terrains, offering breathtaking views of the Himalayas and the vast Tibetan plateau. As we approach Lhasa, catch sight of the magnificent Potala Palace perched atop Red Hill. This iconic landmark marks our arrival in the spiritual heart of Tibet. Upon reaching Lhasa, take some time to acclimatize to the higher altitude. Rest in your hotel and allow your body to adjust to the change. In the evening, enjoy some free time to explore Barkhor Street, a bustling marketplace filled with Tibetan handicrafts and religious items. Witness the devout pilgrims circumambulating the Jokhang Temple, adding a spiritual ambiance to the city. Overnight in Lhasa; meals: B

Today, we begin our two-day exploration of Lhasa, delving deeper into the rich cultural and spiritual heritage of this mystical city. Start the day with a visit to the iconic Potala Palace, an architectural marvel and a symbol of Tibetan Buddhism. Explore the various chambers, halls, and chapels adorned with stunning artworks and sacred relics. From the rooftop, enjoy panoramic views of Lhasa and the surrounding landscapes. Next, head to the revered Jokhang Temple, the spiritual heart of Lhasa and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Marvel at the exquisite Tibetan architecture as you join the devout pilgrims on the kora (circular pilgrimage route) around the temple. Inside, discover the holy sanctum housing the Jowo Rinpoche, a revered image of Buddha at the age of 12. After visiting the Jokhang Temple, take a leisurely stroll through the vibrant Barkhor Street. Immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere, interact with local vendors, and shop for authentic Tibetan handicrafts and souvenirs. This bustling marketplace is a hub of Tibetan culture and commerce. In the afternoon, visit Sera Monastery, one of the three great Gelug university monasteries. Witness the captivating debates among the monks, a unique and important tradition in Tibetan Buddhism. Overnight in Lhasa; meals: B

Start the day with a visit to Drepung Monastery, once the largest monastery in the world and an important seat of learning in Tibetan Buddhism. Explore the fascinating history and architecture of this ancient monastic complex. Next, visit Norbulingka Palace, the traditional summer residence of the Dalai Lama. Stroll through the lush gardens and serene surroundings of this historic palace, which reflects the Dalai Lama's deep connection with nature. Delve deeper into Tibet's rich history and culture with a visit to the Tibet Museum. The museum houses a vast collection of artifacts, artworks, and historical documents that showcase the heritage and traditions of the Tibetan people. Take some free time to interact with the friendly locals, learn about their way of life, and perhaps join in some traditional Tibetan activities. This is an opportunity to gain insights into the daily lives and customs of the Tibetan community. As this incredible journey comes to an end, bid farewell to Lhasa and the wonders of Tibet. Depart with a deep appreciation for the cultural riches and spiritual depth of this mystical land, and memories that will last a lifetime. Overnight in Lhasa; meals: B

On this day, we begin our return journey from Lhasa back to Kathmandu, Nepal. Our first leg of the drive will take us to the town of Gyirong, where we will rest for the night. As we pass by the majestic Karola Glacier, you might have another chance to witness the glistening ice formations and learn about its significance in Tibetan culture. Arriving in Gyirong, we'll check into our accommodation and rest for the night. Enjoy the serene ambiance and the peaceful surroundings of this quaint town. Overnight in Gyirong; Meals: B

Today marks the final leg of our epic journey as we drive from Gyirong to Kathmandu, concluding our unforgettable Nepal and Tibet expedition. After breakfast, we'll complete the necessary immigration formalities to cross the Nepal-Tibet border at Rasuwagadhi. Our experienced team will assist you throughout the process to ensure a smooth transition. As we enter Nepal, get ready to relish the picturesque landscapes and charming rural scenery along the route. The drive from the border to Kathmandu offers a wonderful blend of natural beauty and cultural encounters. In the evening, we'll gather for a special farewell dinner, celebrating the memories, friendships, and experiences shared throughout the trip. As our Nepal and Tibet expedition comes to a close, bid farewell to your fellow travelers and the diverse wonders of these two enchanting lands. Depart with a treasure trove of memories, cultural insights, and a deeper appreciation for the beauty of the Himalayas and the rich tapestry of human history and spirituality. Safe travels on your onward journey, and until we meet again! Overnight in Kathmandu; meals: B, D

Today marks the end of our unforgettable journey through Nepal and Tibet. Depending on your flight schedule, you may have some free time in Kathmandu before departing for your home country or onward destination. We will take you to the airport 3 hours prior the departure. Safe jounrney and namaste! Meals: B

generalInfo:
Discover the profound spiritual heritage of Nepal with our exclusive 10-day Buddhism Circle tour, a unique journey through the sacred sites and serene landscapes that have shaped Buddhist practices for centuries. Nestled in the lap of the majestic Himalayas, Nepal is a harmonious blend of Hindu and Buddhist traditions, making it a spiritual haven for seekers from around the world.

Begin your pilgrimage in the Kathmandu Valley, where you will visit the ancient Swayambhunath Stupa, also known as the Monkey Temple, a site that has stood for over 2,000 years. Marvel at the world's largest stupa, Bouddhanath, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a focal point for Tibetan Buddhism in Nepal.

Our journey continues beyond the bustling city to Namobuddha, a revered site where Lord Buddha, in a previous life, is believed to have sacrificed his body to feed a starving tigress and her cubs. This visit includes a picturesque hike through lush hills, offering both spiritual and natural beauty.

In the enchanting city of Pokhara, you will explore the World Peace Pagoda, perched on a hilltop above the tranquil Phewa Lake. This serene spot offers breathtaking views of the Annapurna range and a peaceful environment for meditation and reflection.

The highlight of our tour is Lumbini, the birthplace of Gautam Buddha. Walk in the footsteps of the Enlightened One as you visit the Maya Devi Temple and the sacred garden, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that draws pilgrims from across the globe.

Our Buddhism Circle tour in Nepal is more than just a spiritual journey; it is an immersive experience into the rich cultural and natural tapestry of this Himalayan nation. From ancient stupas to serene lakes and verdant hills, each day of this tour will deepen your understanding of Buddhism and its harmonious coexistence with Hinduism in Nepal.

Join us on this unforgettable journey to explore the sacred Buddhist sites, experience the vibrant culture, and witness the stunning natural beauty of Nepal. This is not just a tour; it is a path to spiritual enlightenment and a deeper connection with the rich heritage of Buddhism.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL. Upon your arrival in the Tribhuvan International Airport, our representative will be there to greet you a warm welcome. With the help of our representative, you will be escorted to the hotel. After check-in at the hotel, you can take rest for a while. At evening, you will be invited for dinner in a traditional local restaurant. Overnight in Kathmandu; Meals: welcome dinner

KATHMANDU SIGHTSEEING. Today, we will be sightseeing inside Kathmandu Valley. After warm breakfast, we will be visiting to the historical and UNESCO enlisted heritage sites inside the valley that mainly include two Buddhist Shrines (Swoyambhunath and Boudhanath Stupa). Firstly, we will be visiting Swoyambhunath Stupa popularly known as “Monkey Temple” which is one of the oldest Buddhist monuments in the world with more than 2000 years of history. After that, we will be heading towards Boudhanath Stupa which is one of the largest Buddhist Stupa where over 50 Tibetan Gompas and monasteries lie. The monks of these Stupas are mainly from Tibet. This Stupa is popularly known as “Little Tibet”. If time is sufficient we visit Pashupatinath Temple. Overnight in Kathmandu; Meals: B

VISIT NAMOBUDDHA, HIKE TO BALTHALI VILLAGE. Today after breakfast, we will be heading towards Bhaktapur leaving behind the busy crowded Kathmandu City. After reaching Dhulikhel, we will be having a short walk for about an hour or more to reach Namobuddha. Located on slightly elevated land, Namobuddha is a pleasant and out-of-the-way place. Namobuddha is also known as Takmo Lujin. Thrangu Tashi Yangtse Monastery is its main attraction which is a Tibetan Buddhist Monastery in the Karma Kagyu tradition located at the sacred pilgrimage site of Namobuddha. We will be then heading towards Balthali which will take you about 4 hours of walk. Balthali provides scenic views of the eastern Himalayas including Everest range. This hiking trail is peaceful with stunning views of hamlets and gorges and snow-covered peaks. Overnight in Bhalthali village; Meals: B, L, D

VISIT NALA GUMBA. After wrapping up with our breakfast, we will be heading towards Nala Gumba. Nala Gumba is a specific region with historical and religious importance. Dhagpo Sheydrub Ling Monastery is the main attraction of this place built on the top of the hill which is popular among Buddhist as well as Hindu people. We can find different art and sculpture inside the Gumba. After visiting Nala Gumba, we will be transferred back to Kathmandu. Overnight in Kathmandu; Meals B, L

DRIVE TO LUMBINI. Today, we will be leaving for Lumbini after breakfast. Lumbini (the birthplace of Lord Siddhartha Gautam Buddha) is about 10 hours of drive from Kathmandu. Lumbini lies in the Terai region of Nepal which has flatlands than that of Kathmandu. It is the most beautiful Buddhist holy site. Overnight in Lumbini; Meals: B

EXPLORE LUMBINI. Today is the exploration day. Right after breakfast, we will be exploring Lumbini. Lumbini, which is a UNESCO enlisted world heritage site, is a world-famous Buddhist religion and historical place. We will be visiting the Mayadevi Temple where Lord Siddhartha was born and Pushkarni Pond where baby Siddhartha was given his first ritual bath after his birth. Lumbini is also famous for its alluring monuments, monasteries, museums and peace pagoda along with the Ashoka’s Pillar that was erected by Emperor Ashoka (249 BC). It is separated into an eastern and western monastic zone, the eastern having the Theravadin monasteries and the western having Mahayana and Vajrayana monasteries. From early morning to evening, pilgrims from various countries perform chanting and meditation at the site. You can also experience this peaceful and relax meditation there. Overnight in Lumbini; Meals: B

DRIVE TO POKHARA. After having our breakfast, today, we will be transferred to Pokhara which will take about 9 hours of drive. Pokhara is one of the beautiful cities of Nepal which is also called the city of lakes. You can have splendid panoramic views of mountains like Fishtail, Dhaulagiri and many more. You can also have an evening walk around the lakeside of Pokhara or can go for lakeside cycling. Overnight in Pokhara; Meals: B

EXPLORE POKHARA. This day, we will be visiting some of the Buddhist Landmarks in Pokhara. Our first visit of the day is the massive Buddhist Stupa of World Peace Pagoda which was constructed by Buddhist Monks from the Japanese Nipponzan Myohji Organization on a narrow ridge high above Phewa Lake. We cross the Phewa Lake on a boat and then hike to the Stupa. You can enjoy mesmerizing views of various mountains from the top. Matepani Gomba or monastery and Hemja monastery are the next attractions of Pokhara. The next hiking to Hyangja, the site for Tibetan refugees camp also has Tashi Palkhiel monastery in the tradition of Karma Kagyu tradition. Finally, the boating on Phewa Lake is one of the beautiful memories that you will carry with you when you leave. Overnight in Pokhara; Meals: B

KATHMANDU. Today, we head back to Kathmandu. The journey will take about 30 minutes as we take a beautiful flight. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, you will be transferred to your hotel. You can have rest for the rest of the day or explore the town on your own and visit a peaceful Garden of Dream. The evening will be followed by a farewell dinner. Overnight in Kathmandu; Meals: B, farewell dinner

DEPARTURE. This is the day you will depart for your home. You can either go for short shopping or go for a complimentary Herbal massage spa to relax if you have enough time. After your shopping activity, our representative will escort you to the airport and greet you farewell in Nepali Style. Meals: B

generalInfo:
Explore the wonderful culture and nature that Nepal has to offer on this tour without breaking the bank!
Check out the fantastic nature with majestic mountain ranges and wildlife park, the spiritual tranquillity that Nepal has to offer with a monastery stay and the well-being retreat and top it off by learning about the exciting cultural aspects with the homestay.
Dive right in to all of the above with a constant backdrop jaw-dropping views of Himalayan beauty.

What’s included?
• All transportation within India, including all inter-city transfers and all
transportation to and from included activities.
• All accommodation - usually in hostel and one overnight desert camping experience
• All taxes and charges.
• Indian bilingual tour guides.
• All entrance tickets to attractions listed on the itinerary, unless marked as
optional.
• The following unmissable activities:
*Kathmandu Day tour on temples: Swayambhunath Stupa Temple (monkey temple), Boudhhanath & Evening Prayers at Pashupatinth Temple. (Kathmandu)
*Whitewater rafting on Trishuli River (Trishuli River)
*Momo Making class (Nagarkot)
*Walking tour of Bhaktapur (Bhaktapur)
*Monastery evening experience (Pharphing)
*Monastery morning experience: Morning Prayers, Breakfast with monks in their refectory, walk to the cave where the Great Master Padmasambhava meditated.
*Meditaton class
*National Park entrance fee
*Watching elephant bathing
*Jeep safari
*Maya Devi Temple entrance
*Boating on Phewa Taal Lake
*3-day Poon Hill Trek or Meditation and Yoga retreat
*Walking tour of Bandipur

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu: Our Nepalese adventure begins in the nation's capital: Kathmandu. We'll have a pre-departure briefing before checking out the city's bustling Thamel District and it's array of live music bars.

Kathmandu: A tempo tour through the city. These large rickshaws will be our vehicles through the various sights of Kathmandu. We'll hop into temples, world heritage sites and spend the evening watching the prayers at the famous Pashupatinath Temple.

Nagarkot: Transfer to Lalitpur and explore the temples of a living goddess. Enjoy the sites of the Golden Temple and Banla Mukhi Temple. Next, transfer to Nagarkot and enjoy a free afternoon where you can explore on your own terms. Here you have an option to take a 30-minute hike to the perfect sunset viewpoint.

Bhaktapur + Pharphing + Kathmandu: Enjoy a walking tour of Bhaktapur, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Next, transfer to Pharphing where we will arrive at the Monastery to see monks debating and praying. Walk to the cave where the Great Master Padmasmbhava mediated. This evening we will return back to Kathmandu.

Chitwan National Park: Enjoy on a truly stunning day as we travel to Chitwan National Park. Embark on a Jeep Safari where you might see rhinos, sloth bears, leopards, deer, monkeys, crocodiles and even a tiger! Next, we take a canoe trip on the river and enjoy coffee by the riverside as the sun sets. End the evening watching the Tharu Cultural Show.

Lumbini: Transfer to Lumbini and enjoy food at the hotel when you arrive. Explore Maya Devi Temple - The Birth place of Buddha. Try meditation in the Ashok part of the temple grounds. There are other several temples to visit where you can practice short meditation with the Adventure Leader!
Pokhara: Today we are in Pokhara. Enjoy a free afternoon where you can explore this new destination. Later this afternoon, enjoy a Momo Making Class and enjoy feasting on your own creations!

Pokhara: An optional activity awaits for you to glide amidst the mountain peaks, lakes and rivers on a paragliding trip or simple kick back in this charming town. That afternoon- we'll take out boats on the Phewa Taal Lake and absorb the views. Breathe in the natural wonder or take some insta-credible snaps. That night, chill out at the Movie Garden- a local institution showing movies, outdoor.

3 Day Poon Hill Trek or Yoga & Wellness Retreat: For the next 3 days- you have the choice of hiking deep into the Himalayas with a trek through soaring mountain peaks and traversing glacially carved valleys. Rest up in mountain villages on this trek which is manageable for those with moderate fitness. Alternatively, take part in a 3 day yoga and wellness retreat. This experience involves yoga classes, meditations and a whole range of other activities including mid baths and aromatherapy. On Day 11: If you've hiked, you can check out the yoga experience or, if you've been on the wellness retreat- you can do a short morning hike in the beautiful mountains. Or- simply kick back with a deep tissue massage.

Bandipur: Transfer to Bandipur and enjoy a walk through the town and its surrounding areas. Soak up the charms of this beautifully preserved village. In the evening you can go to Bandipur Town centre and have dinner together.

Kathmandu: This morning we transfer to Fissling and enjoy an exciting final activity of white water rafting! Enjoy the adrenaline pumping activity with your fellow Dragons before heading back to Kathmandu. We'll return to Kathmandu around 5-6pm! Bid farewell to your group having had 2 weeks in this magical, mountainous paradise.

tourName: Nepal budget tiger safari in Chitwan NP
generalInfo:
Introduction:
This budget Chitwan tiger safari holiday is a great way of exploring this incredible park and go in search of wildlife such as tigers, rhinos, sloth bears elephants and many other species. Nepal and in particular Chitwan is one of the few places in the world where you can track tigers on foot and indeed Chitwan has the largest population of tigers in the whole of Nepal, some 120 plus tigers are known from Nepal.

Chitwan National Park is a combination of jungle, sal forest, grassland and river systems all of which are ideal habitat for tiger as well as many other mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians and fish. This makes the park one of the greatest wildlife watching locations in the world. Chitwan has very high densities of rhinos, tigers and sloth bears - among the highest densities of these species in the world and so you have very good chances of seeing these animals when exploring the park in full.

All of our tiger safaris are guided by a zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) as well as local naturalist guides, drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible. This not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits. We are proud of the fact that we have a 75% success of spotting tigers in Nepal, with a 60% success in spotting them on foot whilst tracking tigers in Chitwan. The fitness level required for our tiger safaris, is a moderate level of walking in Nepal (as tiger tracking on foot through the forests and grasslands can last for 7-8 hours).

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned. There will be filtered or boiled water available for each guest each day. We have our own private AC vehicles with an excellent driver for all vehicular transfers. You will have a local cultural and naturalist guides. The guides have spent years in Nepal (and in particular Chitwan) and know the places and wildlife and local villages. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide).


Best time to go on a tiger safari in Nepal:

For tiger watching in Nepal we recommend mid January to mid May which is the middle and end of the hot dry season when wildlife gather at waterholes.

Why choose this tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced local naturalist or guides as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• This specific wildlife tour is one of the few in the world that explores remote and wilderness areas of Bhutan in the company of expert guides.
• We provide camera traps for you to set up and you are free to use any and all of the photographs and videos that this camera trap gets during your stay.
• All the above reasons give this, our unique Chitwan Budget Tiger Safari Holiday a great success rate of seeing rare wildlife. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Nepal which explore other areas and focus on other species such as Jungle cats, Snow Leopards and Red pandas as well as many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari. We are also experts in organising treks in the Nepalese Himalayas.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).
• We also contribute to Tour Operators for Tigers (TOFT) which is an NGO in the the Indian Subcontinent which is dedicated the sustainable and eco friendly future of tiger tourism.

Locations:

This tour explores the massive, famous park of Chitwan in south central Nepal in the teari ecosystem. The entry and exit port of this tour is the wonderful and iconic city of Kathmandu.

Fitness Level:

The fitness level required for our Chitwan Tiger Safari wildlife holiday is relatively high. This is because we include jungle hikes, these are either full days (7-8 hours) or half days (3-4 hours) inside the park hiking. The terrain is rough and the heat can be very hot and fatiguing. There are also dangerous animals around (such as rhinos and elephants) and on rare occasions evasive action is needed to avoid these animals.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking. We can also include specialist equipment on request such as camera traps, infrared cameras, thermal imaging equipment and spotlights.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu - Arrival & Sightseeing When you arrive into Kathmandu international airport you will be met by your local guide/driver and you will be transferred to your accommodation in Kathmandu. Depending on what time your flight arrives you may have time to do some sightseeing around Kathmandu, you can arrange this in advance of booking or with the hotel on your arrival. (no meals included today).

Chitwan National Park - Travelling After your breakfast at the hotel your driver will collect you and take you to the take of town of Sauraha (6-7 hours), which is the gateway village for Chitwan National Park. When you get to the park and your accommodation. The rest of the day will be free for you to rest and prepare for exploring the park tomorrow. You can have a village tour in the evening to learn more about the Tharu people who are the indigenous people of the Terai region. We also recommend watching the sunset over Chitwan from the banks of the Rapti River and hopefully spot some migratory birds like ruddy shelducks or even a mugger crocodile. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Kathmandu - Travelling & Sightseeing After breakfast today you will be collected from the lodge and taken back to Kathmandu in your private vehicle (~6-7 hours). Once you arrive back you can have some sightseeing around the historical city and this can be arranged with the guide or the hotel directly. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure Today after breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Group Tour Departure: 1st May - 11th May 2022

There will be filtered or boiled water available for each guest each day. We have our own private AC vehicles with an excellent driver for all vehicular transfers. You will have a local cultural and naturalist guides. The guides have spent years in Nepal (and in particular Chitwan) and know the places and wildlife and local villages. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide).


Best time to go on a tiger safari in Nepal:

For tiger watching in Nepal we recommend mid January to mid May which is the middle and end of the hot dry season when wildlife gather at waterholes.

Why choose this tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced local naturalist or guides as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• This specific wildlife tour is one of the few in the world that explores remote and wilderness areas of Bhutan in the company of expert guides.
• We provide camera traps for you to set up and you are free to use any and all of the photographs and videos that this camera trap gets during your stay.
• All the above reasons give this, our unique Chitwan Budget Tiger Safari Holiday a great success rate of seeing rare wildlife. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Nepal which explore other areas and focus on other species such as Jungle cats, Snow Leopards and Red pandas as well as many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari. We are also experts in organising treks in the Nepalese Himalayas.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).
• We also contribute to Tour Operators for Tigers (TOFT) which is an NGO in the the Indian Subcontinent which is dedicated the sustainable and eco friendly future of tiger tourism.

Locations:

This tour explores the massive, famous park of Chitwan in south central Nepal in the teari ecosystem. The entry and exit port of this tour is the wonderful and iconic city of Kathmandu.

Fitness Level:

The fitness level required for our Chitwan Tiger Safari wildlife holiday is relatively high. This is because we include jungle hikes, these are either full days (7-8 hours) or half days (3-4 hours) inside the park hiking. The terrain is rough and the heat can be very hot and fatiguing. There are also dangerous animals around (such as rhinos and elephants) and on rare occasions evasive action is needed to avoid these animals.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking. We can also include specialist equipment on request such as camera traps, infrared cameras, thermal imaging equipment and spotlights.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu - Arrival & Sightseeing When you arrive into Kathmandu international airport you will be met by your local guide/driver and you will be transferred to your accommodation in Kathmandu. Depending on what time your flight arrives you may have time to do some sightseeing around Kathmandu, you can arrange this in advance of booking or with the hotel on your arrival. (no meals included today).

Chitwan National Park - Travelling After your breakfast at the hotel your driver will collect you and take you to the take of town of Sauraha (6-7 hours), which is the gateway village for Chitwan National Park. When you get to the park and your accommodation. The rest of the day will be free for you to rest and prepare for exploring the park tomorrow. You can have a village tour in the evening to learn more about the Tharu people who are the indigenous people of the Terai region. We also recommend watching the sunset over Chitwan from the banks of the Rapti River and hopefully spot some migratory birds like ruddy shelducks or even a mugger crocodile. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

Kathmandu - Travelling & Sightseeing After breakfast today you will be collected from the lodge and taken back to Kathmandu in your private vehicle (~6-7 hours). Once you arrive back you can have some sightseeing around the historical city and this can be arranged with the guide or the hotel directly. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure Today after breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

generalInfo:
Introduction:
For a very long time clouded leopards were among the top of every wildlife enthusiasts wish lists (which has not changed), but for a long time the chances of seeing one were lottery like odds. Very few people were ever lucky enough to happen chance across one as they trekked in various forests around South and South East Asia. All of that changed around 5 years ago when a wonderful forestry department opened its up for tourism in Sabah, Malaysia (Deramakot Forest Reserve) and the rate of seeing this wonderful species shot up drastically. But nearly at the same time as this location arrived on the wildlife watching scene the clouded leopard was split into two different species; the Indochinese clouded leopard (native to the mainland of Asia) and the Sunda clouded leopard (found on Sumatra and Borneo). So whilst seeing the Sunda clouded leopard is now possible (although still with some luck and the right guides), there remained nowhere to see the Indochinese clouded leopard – well that was until very recently.
Due to some very adventurous solo travellers and the incredible work of clouded leopard researchers various parks and forests in the north-east of India and along the Himalayan foothills of Nepal have been extensively studied and tracked with views of finding clouded leopard populations and possibly getting a sighting. The breakthrough came in late 2018 and since then we have been working hard with the best clouded leopard researchers in Nepal to pioneer the first ever group tour to try and find this species. We have also hired the serviced of Mike Gordon, the dedicated and passionate wildlife spotter and guide from Sabah, made famous for his numerous sightings of Sunda clouded leopards. Possibly no one in the world understands this species better than Mike and we are delighted that he will be guiding our new Clouded Leopard Expeditions to Nepal.
But there are other advantages of travelling to this region of Nepal to look for this species of clouded leopard, not just that it is a different species from the Bornean ones, but also that Nepal offers a brand new wildlife experience and also the price is cheaper and a whole new set of species can be seen in these forests too.
So why not branch out and away from Sabah, Borneo and cast the clouded leopard net wider. This tour is unique and offers the chance to explore a wonderful forest which is seldom visited and little understood. But in recent times this area has become a hotbed for clouded leopard sightings.
We do our best to pioneer as many new trips as possible, to try and get people out to the newest and best wildlife watching destinations ahead of the larger companies and the bigger groups. This is the latest in a long list of pioneering mammal watching tours from us and it will not be the last.
So we hope you decide to book on this unique big cat watching tour, dedicated to the Indochinese clouded leopard, however if you wish to know more about the Sunda clouded leopard we also offer a rare mammals tour of Borneo where the Sunda clouded leopard is a top targeted species. Just contact us for more information or our brochure.

Group Tour Departure: 11th November - 20th November 2022
Group Tour Departure: 5th December - 14th December 2022

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned. There will be filtered or boiled water available for each guest each day. We have our own private AC vehicles with an excellent driver for all vehicular transfers. You will have a local cultural and naturalist guides including a Nepalese clouded leopard specialist. We also have a the expert help of the world's most renowned clouded leopard guide from Borneo. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us). We also have high powered spotlights, quality optical equipment, night-vision and thermal imaging equipment (on request).


Best time for this Nepal expedition for clouded leopards:

This tour can be booked anytime of the year, however we recommend avoiding the height of winter. And we think that spring and autumn are the best seasons to visit. This would be from late February – May and then September – mid November.

Why choose this tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced local naturalist or guides as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We employ three different specialist clouded leopard guides, firstly a local guide who knows the particular region intimately, secondly a Nepalese biologist who specialises in clouded leopards and then a guide who has probably see more clouded leopards than any living person.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• This specific wildlife tour is one of the few in the world that explores remote and wilderness areas of Nepal in the company of expert guides.
• We provide camera traps for you to set up and you are free to use any and all of the photographs and videos that this camera trap gets during your stay.
• All the above reasons give this, our unique Clouded Leopard Expedition of Nepal a great success rate of seeing rare wildlife. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Nepal which explore other areas and focus on other species such as Tigers, One-horned Rhinos, Jungle cats and Red pandas as well as many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari. We are also experts in organising treks in the Nepalese Himalayas.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour explores the massive and famous national park of Langtang in central Nepal. The entry and exit point of this tour is the wonderful and iconic city of Kathmandu.

Fitness Level:

The fitness level required for our Nepal Clouded Leopard Expedition is relatively high. This is because the tour is at altitude and the hiking to and from the guesthouse and the hiking to get to observation points can be steep and on uneven ground. Anyone who is used to hiking for 2-3 hours at a time (preferably at altitude) will not have a problem, anyone who has experienced altitude whilst hiking will most likely also be ok.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking. We can also include specialist equipment on request such as camera traps, infrared cameras, thermal imaging equipment and spotlights.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu On arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport you will be met by your tour guide and our local guide/driver. From the airport we will be transferred in our private vehicle into the middle of Kathmandu (20-30 mins). Once here we will head to the Thamel district and your hotel for the night. If there is time you will be taken around the winding streets of Thamel. This area is the heartbeat of Kathmandu and a place which teems with colour, sights and sounds. You can easily get lost meandering down the maze of streets souvenir shopping and we can spend hours here enjoying the hustle and bustle of Nepal’s busiest city. Whilst still very touristy Thamel is a good welcome to Nepal and in particular Kathmandu. If time allows we will have a short city tour today, however it depends on the arrival times of all of the clients booked on the trip. However Thamel is safe to walk around and with a large selection of restaurants your guide can point you in the right direction for your evening meal, alternatively you can rest and prepare for the long car journey tomorrow morning to get to Lantang district. Depending on the time we arrive back into Kathmandu on the final day of the trip we will look to conduct some sightseeing around the city and show you some of the better known sites such as Boudnath Stupa, which is the largest Buddhist stupa in the world and a very important place for Nepalese Buddhists. We will then visit the hilltop temples at Swayambunath that are dedicated to Hanuman the monkey god n Hindu mythology; alongside the playful macaques the views over Kathmandu are worth the long climb up alone. We then visit the historical Royal palaces and temples of the bustling Durbur Square.

Kathmandu to Langtang District This morning you will be collected from the hotel after breakfast and transported around 3 hours north towards the Langtang district of Nepal in our own vehicle. On arrival we will either set up the camp or check into the local guest house (depending on what is recommended by the local guide (based on clouded leopard sightings)) we will head out into the forest with the local ranger and Mike to try and locate some wildlife, including clouded leopards. We can also go out after dark looking, however many of the sightings are made during the day, so we will focus during the day, but also there will be some spotlighting offered each night.

Langtang District - Kathmandu This morning is your last opportunity to explore the forests here looking for wildlife, before we depart and leave in our private vehicle and head back to Kathmandu. On arrival back in the city you will be taken to the same accommodation as on the first day here and if we arrive in time and you would like we can look to do some sightseeing if you wish, such as visiting Boudnath Stupa, Swayambunath and Durbar Square; however the time of arrival into Kathmandu will dictate that and this sightseeing trip would be extra and arranged with the accommodation.
Home This morning you will have a private transfer arranged for you to get you to the airport in order to catch your return flight home or onward to your next destination.

generalInfo:
Embark on a captivating 14-day journey through Nepal, where cultural discovery meets hands-on experiences. Begin in Kathmandu with a soothing sound-healing session, then explore the city’s sacred landmarks. In Patan, immerse yourself in Newar heritage with a Paubha painting workshop, blending art and meditation.

Travel to Nagarkot, where you’ll join local families in their homes, engaging in traditional crafts like pottery and communal cooking, complemented by sunrise yoga and a hike to Jalpa Devi Temple.

In Chitwan, experience the vibrant culture of the indigenous Tharu people through cooking classes, cycling, and traditional dances, culminating in a thrilling safari in Chitwan National Park.

Finally, enjoy the stunning backdrop of the Himalayas in Pokhara and the village of Hemjakot, exploring local crafts and savoring Newar cuisine in Kirtipur, ensuring an unforgettable and immersive adventure.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Nepal! Upon your arrival in Kathmandu, you'll be greeted at the airport and transferred to your hotel. After check-in and freshening up, enjoy a relaxing, sound-healing session to recover from any jet lag. This will be followed by a healthy dinner before you'll then be taken back to your hotel for a restful night. Overnight at Babar Mahal Villas (D)

Discover Kathmandu. A day of sightseeing in Kathmandu. Enjoy a guided Kathmandu sightseeing tour focusing on the UNESCO World Heritage sites of Pashupatinath Temple, Boudhanath Stupa, and Kathmandu Durbar Square. Pashupatinath is a sacred Hindu temple complex, Boudhanath is the largest stupa in Nepal, and Kathmandu Durbar Square is the former royal residence and a museum of temples. Overnight at Babar Mahal Villas (B)

Explore Patan and Paubha Painting. Patan is comparatively quiet, surrounded by peaceful palace courtyards, shops, and pagoda temples. The museum here is in a historic royal complex, showcasing Hindu and Buddhist artefacts, sculptures, and elaborate woodcarvings, with educational displays on Newar history. Join a Paubha Painting Workshop to explore the vibrant Newar culture through its sacred art form. Guided by experienced artisans, you'll learn intricate painting techniques while enjoying a meditative and educational experience. Overnight at Babar Mahal Villas (BL)

Nagarkot. Visit Thimi for a pottery-making session with a local artisan and explore Bhaktapur’s historic Durbar Square. Travel to Nagarkot, where you’ll be warmly welcomed by your homestay family and engage in cultural activities like making Tapari (leaf plates) and Batti (wicks). End the day connecting with the community. Drive Duration: 1 hour approx. Overnight at Nagarkot Community Homestay (BLD)

Nagarkot. Start your day with Hatha yoga at Shanti Danda. Then, enjoy a community hike with valley views and a visit to Jalpa Devi Temple. In the evening, cook a traditional Nepali meal with your hosts. Hike Duration: 3-3.5 hours approx. Overnight at Nagarkot Community Homestay (BLD)

Chitwan. Transfer to the airport for a domestic flight to Bharatpur. On arrival you will be taken to the Barauli Community Homestay and enjoy a cultural experience this evening. Overnight at Barauli Community Homestay (BLD)

Chitwan National Park Safari. Discover Chitwan National Park on a jeep safari where you may spot rhinos, crocodiles and much more. Later, enjoy a guided cycling tour around the park's outskirts, taking in the local scenery and wildlife, before learning how to prepare traditional Tharu dishes with a local expert. Overnight at Barauli Community Homestay (BLD)
Pokhara. Leave Chitwan and catch a domestic flight to Pokhara. On arrival the rest of the day is free to relax or explore. Overnight at Fishtail Lodge (B)

Sarangkot and Pokhara. Sarangkot is a must-do sunrise experience for anyone visiting Pokhara. You will be picked up from your hotel and driven to the base of Sarangkot Hill, a 30-minute drive from the lakeside. After walking up the stairs for about 15 minutes, you will find a good spot to watch the sunrise with a breathtaking view. The rest of the day is free time to explore in Pokhara. Overnight at Fishtail Lodge (B)

Hemjakot. Hemjakot is a peaceful rural village in the Annapurna region. It offers stunning views of the Annapurna ranges, including Mt. Machhapuchhre. This village is ideal for those seeking an authentic experience of Nepali village life, where traditional culture meets the breathtaking natural beauty of the Himalayas. The settlement is rural, offering a genuine experience of Gurung culture and hospitality. Experience a cooking class and enjoy the flavours of traditional Nepali cuisine, with dishes that are prepared using fresh, local ingredients. The culinary experience in Hemjakot is deeply connected to the region's agricultural lifestyle. Guests can also enjoy the local alcohol-making process and taste it if the time is favourable. Overnight at Fishtail Lodge (BLD)
Return to Kathmandu. Transfer to Pokhara airport for a flight to Kathmandu. On arrival you will transfer to your hotel with the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight at Babar Mahal Villas (B)

Bhaktapur Wood Carving. Today you will discover the ancient art of wood carving in Bhaktapur with a hands-on workshop that immerses you in traditional craftsmanship and cultural heritage. This workshop offers an in-depth introduction to wood carving, guided by skilled artisans who bring years of experience to their craft. You'll be able to create your wooden masterpiece while learning about the techniques and cultural significance behind this traditional art form. Overnight at Babar Mahal Villas (BL)

Kirtipur. Kirtipur, just 5 km from Kathmandu, offers an immersive experience in the heart of Nepal’s Newar culture. Here, visitors can discover the ancient Ranjana Lipi script, participate in a momo-making workshop, and explore the town's rich heritage. Kirtipur is also renowned for its gastro tourism, where you can savour traditional Newari cuisine, including the famous Yomari, a sweet, steamed dumpling. Overnight at Babar Mahal Villas (BL)
Depart Nepal. Departure transfer to the airport at a suitable time. Checkout time from the hotel is 12 noon. (B)

generalInfo:
Nepal, a country renowned for its majestic Himalayan peaks, ancient heritage, and warm hospitality, offers an unforgettable blend of cultural depth and natural wonder. This 7-day Nepal Culture & Adventure Holiday introduces you to the essence of the country—from the spiritual heart of Kathmandu to the serene beauty and adventure-filled landscapes of Pokhara.

Your journey begins in Kathmandu, a vibrant city where centuries-old temples, royal courtyards, and sacred shrines coexist with bustling marketplaces and traditional lifestyles. Here, you will explore iconic UNESCO World Heritage Sites, including the revered Pashupatinath Temple, the monumental Boudhanath Stupa, and the hilltop sanctuary of Swayambhunath, while immersing yourself in the artistic legacy of the medieval cities of Bhaktapur and Patan.

From Kathmandu, the journey transitions into adventure as you travel west toward Pokhara, stopping for an exciting white-water rafting experience along the scenic Trishuli River. Pokhara, often described as the “Jewel of the Himalayas,” welcomes you with its peaceful lakes, subtropical climate, and awe-inspiring views of the Annapurna mountain range. Whether it’s watching a golden sunrise from Sarangkot, boating on the calm waters of Phewa Lake, or exploring natural wonders like the Seti River Gorge and Mahendra Cave, Pokhara offers the perfect blend of tranquility and thrill.

Throughout the journey, you will witness Nepal’s diverse landscapes—lush valleys, terraced hills, rivers, and forests—while experiencing the cultural richness, spiritual heritage, and natural beauty that make Nepal a truly magical destination. This itinerary provides a perfect balance of exploration, relaxation, and adventure, ideal for travelers seeking both cultural immersion and outdoor excitement.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Kathmandu: Arrive at Tribhuvan International Airport, where you will be warmly received by our representative. Enjoy a comfortable transfer to your hotel. Take the rest of the day to relax or explore the vibrant streets of Kathmandu at your leisure. Overnight in Kathmandu.

Kathmandu Valley Cultural Tour: After breakfast, begin your cultural exploration at Pashupatinath Temple, one of the holiest Hindu shrines in Nepal. Continue to Boudhanath Stupa, the largest stupa in the country and a spiritual center for Tibetan Buddhism. Later, drive to the medieval city of Bhaktapur, famous for its beautifully preserved Durbar Square, intricately carved temples, courtyards, and wood-crafted architecture. Overnight in Kathmandu.

Heritage Tour of Kathmandu & Patan: Enjoy breakfast before embarking on a full-day sightseeing tour. Visit the historic Kathmandu Durbar Square, once the royal residence of Nepal’s Malla and Shah kings. See the Kumari Ghar, home of the Living Goddess. Continue to Swayambhunath Stupa—the "Monkey Temple" - for panoramic views over the Kathmandu Valley. In the afternoon, explore the ancient city of Patan (Lalitpur) with its rich artisan heritage, including the Krishna Mandir, Golden Temple, and centuries-old courtyards. Overnight in Kathmandu.

Kathmandu to Pokhara via Trishuli River Rafting: After breakfast, drive toward Pokhara with an adventurous stop en route. Experience 2–3 hours of exhilarating white-water rafting on the Trishuli River as you navigate scenic gorges and exciting rapids. Continue your drive to Pokhara, a serene lakeside city surrounded by stunning Himalayan scenery. Overnight in Pokhara.

Pokhara Sightseeing & Himalayan Sunrise: Start early with a drive to Sarangkot, famous for its breathtaking sunrise views over the Annapurna and Dhaulagiri ranges. After breakfast, enjoy a half-day tour of Pokhara: • Peaceful boating on Phewa Lake with reflections of the stunning Machhapuchhre (Fishtail Peak) • Visit to the dramatic Seti River Gorge • Exploration of Mahendra Cave, known for its impressive limestone formations Spend the evening strolling through the lively Lakeside Market, filled with cafés, music, and boutique shops. Overnight in Pokhara.

Scenic Drive Back to Kathmandu: After breakfast, enjoy a scenic 6-hour drive back to Kathmandu. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and enjoy the evening at leisure - ideal for souvenir shopping or sampling local cuisine. Overnight in Kathmandu.
Departure: Enjoy free time until your departure. Our team will transfer you to the airport for your onward journey, carrying wonderful memories of Nepal’s culture and adventure.

generalInfo:
Experience one of our most unique and impactful programs dedicated to the conservation of endangered dolphins in Nepal. This milestone initiative aims to protect wildlife and promote animal conservation in the stunning Bardiya National Park.

Bardiya National Park, established in 1988, is the largest and most undisturbed national park in Nepal, spanning 968 square kilometers. Nestled in the Terai region, it connects to the eastern bank of the Karnali River and is bisected by the Babai River. The park is a biodiversity hotspot, home to over 150 species of reptiles and fish, more than 400 species of birds, and around 48 different mammals, making it an ideal destination for spotting endangered wildlife.

Spend 6 to 7 days in Bardiya National Park to fully immerse yourself in its natural beauty and diverse wildlife. Notably, the park is a haven for wild elephants and the rare Gangetic dolphin. These intelligent mammals, also known as "Susu" due to the unique sound they make while breathing, are found in the Karnali River, Nepal's longest river. Witnessing these dolphins in their natural habitat is a remarkable experience.

This trip is designed for nature lovers, naturalists, wildlife photographers, families, and outdoor enthusiasts. Whether you're passionate about conservation or simply love the great outdoors, our program offers an unforgettable journey into the heart of Nepal's wilderness.

Join us on this extraordinary adventure and contribute to the conservation of Nepal's precious wildlife. Book your trip today and be part of a meaningful journey!

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL. Imagine flying over tallest mountains in the world and landing the jumbled city of Kathmandu from where your venture starts. Our representative will come to greet and meet you at Tribhuvan International Airport from where you will be transferred to your hotel. In the afternoon we will be briefing about the itinerary and if time allows we will have a hearty dinner together. Overnight in hotel in Kathmandu; Meals: welcome dinner

FLY TO NEPALGUNJ. After breakfast, we’ll take a flight from Kathmandu to Nepalgunj. We go to Thakurdwar which is the main village of Bardiya National Park by enjoying the scenic beauty of the Midwestern region. After arriving at the hotel in the evening we will discover Tharu life and culture throughout the village. Our naturalist will introduce our the program and safety rules during your stay. Overnight in a resort; Meals: B, L, D

JUNGLE EXPLORATION. Today after breakfast we go for sightseeing around the Karnali river bank to encounter wildlife. After sightseeing, in the evening we will do jungle safari at Bardiya National Park to enjoy the natural vegetation and wildlife then we return back to the hotel. Overnight in a resort; Meals: B, L, D

BOATING ON THE RIVER On this day after breakfast we go for sightseeing to explore the endangered species of mammals. Then after that, we go boating to observe the river dolphin. Before dinner we take a short village walk. Overnight in a resort; Meals: B, L, D

BIRD WATCHING Early morning we go for the bird watching and exploring the surrounding villages through the lush forest. Our guide will provide you with extensive knowledge of local vegetation and inhabitants. After that, we go for a tour to Banana restaurant, which will make your day complete. Overnight in a resort; Meals: B, L, D

VISIT TO SONAHA COMMUNITY. Today after breakfast we go to visit the Sonaha community where we can interact with the local people and immerse ourselves into original Tharu culture, customs and traditions. We will participate in different activities together with locals. In the evening we go to see the cultural dance program conducted by the Tharu community. Overnight in a resort; Meals: B, L, D

FLY TO KATHMANDU. After doing the entire jungle exploration and many activities in the Bardia National Park we fly back to Kathmandu. In the evening we visit a gorgeous Patan Durbar Square, where living Goddess Kumari lives and conclude our tour at Swoyambunath Temple. Overnight in Kathmandu; Meals: B

DEPARTURE. If time allows, visit Thamel for some last minute shopping and a glimpse of a famous area since 70th. We will assist in your last moment preparation and drop you to the International airport to catch your flight. Say "Namaste" and until next time! Meals: B

generalInfo:
Experience the best of Nepal with our Silver Triangle tour, guiding you through the three most important and famous cities: Pokhara, Chitwan, and Kathmandu. This unforgettable journey starts in the enchanting city of Pokhara, continues through the oldest national park in Chitwan, and culminates in the ancient capital, Kathmandu.

Begin your tour with a picturesque flight to Pokhara, the city of lakes. Our expert guide will lead you to must-see attractions like the World Peace Stupa, Davis Falls, and Mahendra Cave. Enjoy the vibrant nightlife around the lakeside and indulge in adrenaline-pumping adventure sports such as paragliding, parahawking, bungee jumping, zip flying, and skydiving. For a truly unique experience, we highly recommend an ultra-light flight into the mountains, perfect for those who prefer not to trek. These exhilarating moments will create memories to last a lifetime.

Next, we venture to Chitwan. The tour begins with an exciting jungle safari in the UNESCO-listed Chitwan National Park, followed by a visit to the Tharu Cultural Museum and the local villages. This immersive experience allows you to witness the rich biodiversity and cultural heritage of the region.

The final destination is Kathmandu, the capital of Nepal. This ancient city is home to a plethora of diverse monuments, temples, and stupas. The Kathmandu tour includes sightseeing at popular UNESCO-listed sites such as Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple), Pashupatinath, and Bouddhanath. Explore the rich history and spirituality of this bustling city.

Traveling to these three distinct cities in Nepal offers spectacular sceneries, a wide range of adventure activities, and unforgettable memories. The Silver Triangle tour is suitable for everyone, regardless of age or physical condition. Apart from short walks during sightseeing, there are no strenuous activities involved.

If you are eager to visit Nepal's three most popular destinations in one seamless trip, without compromising on safety or comfort, then the Silver Triangle tour is perfect for you.
